commit_message:
Add retries for Dogtag plugin

Some Dogtag gate failures appear to be from memory issues
that show up in NSS.  The Dogtag plugin should be made more
robust by adding a retry mechanism.  Failures from Dogtag should
also be better reported.

Change-Id: I148b1c8e265b327d60d76f88c036b032af014930

commit_message:
Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582
Change-Id: Iebf279ca591e646656f8411934fd58dc43d5f002
(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I8f8f2c2eb65a7f48b901aee6506504d725f2e629
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit d78498a1a3a538d6af7bc94356dec0aa11cd6102)

commit_message:
Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Some style changes are included to make it easier to read,
the copyright notice is added as it should have been from
the start, and a duplicate retry argument is removed.

Change-Id: I11c3da84fa6469764a19b6a387ef312124dfba2a
(cherry picked from commit 130e8da00505469c272ada2048c96225c304836f)

messages:
[{'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:35:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm on the fence about this, but it's a thing that the tripleo CI folks need, so I figured I'd at least propose this."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-16646 : FAILURE in 4m 46s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm on the fence about this, but it's a thing that the tripleo CI
> folks need, so I figured I'd at least propose this.

Correction, not tripleo, though apparently they'll eventually get jobs like this too - just downstream OSP CI."}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:08:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

It is my understanding that does filter don't add extra load unless invoked via scheduler_hints on server creation.

We also set them via devstack, so I believe they belong in the default.

Also, if not on the default, customers sometimes end up deploying, and trying tempest (with the tempest default which expect all those filters too..) and that fails."}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

End customers could also hit non passing tempest tests, because the tempest default is to expect those filters to be enabled.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:13:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Also, if not on the default, customers sometimes end up deploying,
> and trying tempest (with the tempest default which expect all those
> filters too..) and that fails.

For some context, tempest has this bug [1] where setting enabled filters to 'all' in tempest.conf doesn't actually mean all possible filters are enabled, rather than all of the filters in nova's defaults are enabled. This won't be fixed because of backwards compatibility, just the help text got changed. So some tempest tests are making wrong assumptions about what filters are enabled because they're not aware of the (understandably confusing) 'all' nuance.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1628443"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/561651/2/ : FAILURE in 1h 06m 24s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-16 20:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/561651/3/ : FAILURE in 54m 39s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-16 21:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-16673 : FAILURE in 1h 12m 53s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-16 22:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-16 22:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-17 02:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Should also update docs about default filters, probably here:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/queens/user/filter-scheduler.html'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Just to clarify, the filters being added are only an overhead when explicitly invoked through the API:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/fa2c1567c1a61c7cd606583100fd14af70095546/nova/scheduler/filters/affinity_filter.py#L54'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would at least want to see some attempt at polling the operators via the openstack-operators mailing list to get a feeling for how many are already enabling these filters and if they think making them enabled by default is OK.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I would at least want to see some attempt at polling the operators
> via the openstack-operators mailing list to get a feeling for how
> many are already enabling these filters and if they think making
> them enabled by default is OK.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-April/015137.html'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 10:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

(Same|Different)HostFilter not showing up in any response to [1]. Though we might want to still revisit the defaults, since for instance AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter seems to be widely deployed and not in the defaults.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-April/015137.html'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 10:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I did continue the API samples fix in [1] though.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563037/'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

... and proposed a tempest fix here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563015/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 15:35:03.000000000', 'message': "Add DifferentHostFilter to enabled_filters default

The DifferentHostFilter uses the different_host scheduler hint to
place instances on different hosts. This is needed by many CI jobs.
Instead of every job overriding the enabled filters list, this patch
proposes to add DifferentHostFilter to the defaults. What's best for
CI isn't necessarily what's best for users - by that logic nova would
enable all of the filters by default like devstack does. However, we
need some filters to be the defaults, so the line has to be drawn
somehwere. Since DifferentHostFilter is harmless, this patch proposes
to put it on the other side of that line.

Change-Id: I0f4c8d0a0ae539e7d440695ed242a73c469696f8
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 15:57:06.000000000', 'message': "Add (Same|Different)HostFilter to defaults

SameHostFilter and DifferentHostFilter filter hosts according to
scheduler hints. The two filters are needed by many downstream CI
jobs. Instead of every job overriding the enabled filters list, this
patch adds the two filters to the defaults. What's best for CI isn't
necessarily what's best for users - by that logic nova would enable
all of the filters by default like devstack does. However, we need
some filters to be the defaults, so the line has to be drawn
somehwere. Since (Same|Different)HostFilter are harmless, this patch
proposes to put them on the other side of that line.

Change-Id: I0f4c8d0a0ae539e7d440695ed242a73c469696f8
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 20:11:16.000000000', 'message': "Add (Same|Different)HostFilter to defaults

SameHostFilter and DifferentHostFilter filter hosts according to
scheduler hints. The two filters are needed by many downstream CI
jobs. Instead of every job overriding the enabled filters list, this
patch adds the two filters to the defaults. What's best for CI isn't
necessarily what's best for users - by that logic nova would enable
all of the filters by default like devstack does. However, we need
some filters to be the defaults, so the line has to be drawn
somehwere. Since (Same|Different)HostFilter are harmless, this patch
proposes to put them on the other side of that line.

It also turns out we were incorrectly using the SameHostFilter with
regular expressions instead of a UUID in the same_host scheduler hint.
This is removed in this patch.

Change-Id: I0f4c8d0a0ae539e7d440695ed242a73c469696f8
"}]
commit_message:
Add (Same|Different)HostFilter to defaults

SameHostFilter and DifferentHostFilter filter hosts according to
scheduler hints. The two filters are needed by many downstream CI
jobs. Instead of every job overriding the enabled filters list, this
patch adds the two filters to the defaults. What's best for CI isn't
necessarily what's best for users - by that logic nova would enable
all of the filters by default like devstack does. However, we need
some filters to be the defaults, so the line has to be drawn
somehwere. Since (Same|Different)HostFilter are harmless, this patch
proposes to put them on the other side of that line.

It also turns out we were incorrectly using the SameHostFilter with
regular expressions instead of a UUID in the same_host scheduler hint.
This is removed in this patch.

Change-Id: I0f4c8d0a0ae539e7d440695ed242a73c469696f8

Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

commit_message:
Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in httpd for FedRAMP compliance.

We now enforce TLS1.1 or higher for httpd connections, to meet the
requirements for FedRAMP.

Change-Id: If875822f1cb705d17405621e64fea2536edc142a
Related-Bug: #1754368

I think the new header text is great in the case where these validations have been kicked off. The supporting text felt a bit misleading as I expected the warning to disappear after the validations finished running. Since I have validations that didn't pass, the warning stuck around and didn't make sense anymore considering the validations were done running. Maybe it should read "Validations have been kicked off automatically. It's recommended to wait until these run and any errors have been resolved before continuing."?'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-19 08:31:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-19 08:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > pass, the warning stuck around and didn't make sense anymore
 > considering the validations were done running. Maybe it should read
 > "Validations have been kicked off automatically. It's recommended
 > to wait until these run and any errors have been resolved before
 > continuing."?

Good point, thanks! Done.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-04-19 09:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not a huge fan of using the rather colloquial "kicked off" in this context.  It's also a phrasal verb, and the combination of the two will make it harder for non-native speakers to understand.

I suggest using "started" instead.

Also, perhaps we could improve the second sentence: instead of saying "until these run", say "until these finish running".'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > 
 > I suggest using "started" instead.
 > 
 > Also, perhaps we could improve the second sentence: instead of
 > saying "until these run", say "until these finish running".

+1 to these suggestions!'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-19 16:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-19 16:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Improve the deployment confirmation message

The deployment confirmation dialog currently shows a warning message
saying not all pre-deployment validations have passed. This gives the
impression that those validations have failed, even though they have
merely been started when opening the confirmation dialog and haven't
finished yet.

This patch makes it a bit clearer what is actually happening.

Change-Id: I1f72dfcaa02ef5e4a101efc25bf473e0b8909f35

[{'created': '2018-04-19 19:24:47.000000000', 'message': "Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

Closes-Bug: #1765339

Change-Id: I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

Closes-Bug: #1765339

Change-Id: I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle(2.4.0) update break
neutron-lbaas pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E501 line too long
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Story: 2001828
Task: 12584

Change-Id: Ifa5a75745bd03aba6af63422623c5cd9eef344e4
(cherry picked from commit fc126428f055ac5fd0ddd6936b90c79e24bfa8e1)

commit_message:
Move heat_launcher data to /var/log/heat-launcher

We don't want to use /var/tmp anymore because we need a place that is
persistent and consistent with other services.

Also, we need to secure the directory because it containers heat sqlite
with passwords.

Depends-On: I60d086dbbd0be409ff78c35ebce3f25b6ba5c908
Change-Id: I50d786cb19536ca6a7cea62cf57466b5302e8a42

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I0aa57fe2c7558cf2ffe9e1bb981036d8728ba42a
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit fbddccd0864de821f0195e40c5b05f38b480c66b)

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I6ee3814fdee1712fdbe82189495772f45ec9e684
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 2e0afc3de1df59573e43232eb3e46aac25436a21)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 21:55:53.000000000', 'message': "Switch from debian-jessie to debian-stable (stretch)

Now that we have debian-stretch images online for openstack-infra,
we'd like to remove debian-jessie. This updates zuul jobs to use the
debian-stable label, which happens to now be debian-stretch.

Change-Id: I7ea475bbdcde533dfde0a30bb516a5fe3a83cab7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-19 22:12:02.000000000', 'message': "Switch from debian-jessie to debian-stable (stretch)

Now that we have debian-stretch images online for openstack-infra,
we'd like to remove debian-jessie[1]. This updates zuul jobs to use the
debian-stable label, which happens to now be debian-stretch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129573.html

Change-Id: I7ea475bbdcde533dfde0a30bb516a5fe3a83cab7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Switch from debian-jessie to debian-stable (stretch)

Now that we have debian-stretch images online for openstack-infra,
we'd like to remove debian-jessie[1]. This updates zuul jobs to use the
debian-stable label, which happens to now be debian-stretch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129573.html

Change-Id: I7ea475bbdcde533dfde0a30bb516a5fe3a83cab7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 15:24:33.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic37abfb14303b93dfc80398d6e37706a68135cb0
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 89c616ff32a2cb3f871c291ac8ec69a66745dfe3)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic37abfb14303b93dfc80398d6e37706a68135cb0
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 89c616ff32a2cb3f871c291ac8ec69a66745dfe3)

commit_message:
Add gathering of crashed pod logs to post-run job

This ps adds the gathering of previous pod logs to provide a means
for debugging situations where a pod crashes before eventually
succeeding

Change-Id: I26dda14429f7b850951127ab6c9d346a49635bf3

subject: rocky: release python-novaclient 10.2.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

lgtm, but the hash might change.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 00:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck dep merged'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is "bcc7d8f Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete" backwards-incompatible?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:09:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Is "bcc7d8f Stop printing flavor details on successful
 > flavor-delete" backwards-incompatible?

It's a change in the CLI output. From what I understand, since the CLI isn't intended to be used as an API, it's not considered to be a backward-incompatible change. Please let me know if that's not correct.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dependent patch is merged and the hash is still 6049be67c0f66bd2d15c7b52f77dd89ac4ec2e94.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-04-20 02:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-20 03:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > Is "bcc7d8f Stop printing flavor details on successful
 > > flavor-delete" backwards-incompatible?
 > 
 > It's a change in the CLI output. From what I understand, since the
 > CLI isn't intended to be used as an API, it's not considered to be
 > a backward-incompatible change. Please let me know if that's not
 > correct.

I guess it depends on how you define the stable interface for the client. If the nova team does not include the CLI output in that, then it's OK as it is.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 06:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > > Is "bcc7d8f Stop printing flavor details on successful
 > > > flavor-delete" backwards-incompatible?
 > >
 > > It's a change in the CLI output. From what I understand, since
 > the
 > > CLI isn't intended to be used as an API, it's not considered to
 > be
 > > a backward-incompatible change. Please let me know if that's not
 > > correct.
 > 
 > I guess it depends on how you define the stable interface for the
 > client. If the nova team does not include the CLI output in that,
 > then it's OK as it is.

Indeed, the nova team doesn't include CLI output in the stable interface. (The python API of the client is considered the stable interface). Thanks'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For python-novaclient we generally consider changing things like dropping options/arguments/entire commands as backward incompatible changes for the CLI (definitely), but for the output, that's a bit harder since we don't really support people relying on CLI output, as sdague has said many times, it's not a Bash SDK.

As for that one particular change, it was just dropping the output from the flavor-delete command which would dump the flavor information after it deleted it, which is very weird and I can't believe anyone would rely on that behavior, so I think we're OK in this case."}]

commit_message:
Add python3 functional voting and non-voting jobs

In I4052547b5dc1e70a7fb079dcd13ec2a32d5efefe we're removing the plugins
job from the plugins repo and adding it to tests, this will allow us to
use these jobs for the ansible-config_template repo as well as the
openstack-ansible-plugins repo.

Change-Id: Id6c1bfb4b93e7d37c76c891dc537567d7df0d5c5

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot

The ONTAP driver was ignoring the size requested when
creating a share from an existing snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1717263
(cherry picked from commit b14d3513db9269447b865ae4b7bd049236f3259b)

Change-Id: I335f72a8dea49d5855201fc63a7ac22240b60bbf

subject: Trivial: Update pypi url to new url
messages: [{'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-04-20 10:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 10:23:52.000000000', 'message': 'Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

commit_message:
Fix error when /etc/hosts does not exist

Even though this might seem very rare/unusual/non-acceptable
there are cases where the /etc/hosts file does not exist
(or has been moved temporarily). This fix prevents error
from being raised. This furthermore ensure idem-potency
as without the fix, using the role after failure just
works because /etc/hosts has now been created.

Change-Id: Ied4875d4fc6754bb262496e69b231b192166b23c
(cherry picked from commit d5d516ee7c214d09ff5c2ba3eaa2ac92728b4688)

commit_message:
Fix error when /etc/hosts does not exist

Even though this might seem very rare/unusual/non-acceptable
there are cases where the /etc/hosts file does not exist
(or has been moved temporarily). This fix prevents error
from being raised. This furthermore ensure idem-potency
as without the fix, using the role after failure just
works because /etc/hosts has now been created.

Change-Id: Ied4875d4fc6754bb262496e69b231b192166b23c
(cherry picked from commit d5d516ee7c214d09ff5c2ba3eaa2ac92728b4688)

commit_message:
Add `privileged` SCC to SA in OpenShift DevStack

In containerized OpenShift deployments we're not attaching `privileged`
SCC to `kuryr-controller` SA created by DevStack plugin. This causes
kuryr-controller Deployment and kuryr-cni DaemonSet to fail as
`kuryr-controller` SA lacks permissions to run privileged containers.

This commit solves that by using `oadm` to attach the SCC to SA.

Change-Id: I2c827cd986a17e08c94558c852b4a225cfe057a6
Closes-Bug: 1759287
(cherry picked from commit 08ce5650516f10d1ee1f07f5b3c667c7abb3c6c7)

messages: [{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 11:05:26.000000000', 'message': "Create CNI bin dir in OpenShift DevStack plugin

In case of containerized deployment we haven't been creating
$CNI_BIN_DIR directory. This made containerized deployments with
OpenShift to fail. This commit solves that by adding `mkdir` just before
the directory is needed as OpenShift installation should not depend on
Kuryr installation.

Change-Id: Iea797939fdb8dc6f0db4a4f128075b94f85c8073
Closes-Bug: 1759153
(cherry picked from commit 1ab7e66a82e667cb439404f94cd36b2f328d20c6)
"}]
commit_message:
Create CNI bin dir in OpenShift DevStack plugin

In case of containerized deployment we haven't been creating
$CNI_BIN_DIR directory. This made containerized deployments with
OpenShift to fail. This commit solves that by adding `mkdir` just before
the directory is needed as OpenShift installation should not depend on
Kuryr installation.

Change-Id: Iea797939fdb8dc6f0db4a4f128075b94f85c8073
Closes-Bug: 1759153
(cherry picked from commit 1ab7e66a82e667cb439404f94cd36b2f328d20c6)

commit_message:
Add more tags examples to IHA

This commit adds two additional examples about tags, so now we have
concrete examples for either images, flavors and VMs (otherwise these
commands are really hard to find or imagine).

Change-Id: Ib3c245200129faeb2e38a1cc80e66de6ec698b47

commit_message:
Specs rolling upgrades for Heat

Initial spec for rolling upgrades.
- Listed out detail work items in the specification document.
- Listed out detail primary assignee.
- Added assert "assert:supports-rolling-upgrade" tag for Heat.

Co-Authored-By: Kien Nguyen <KienNT@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I1ad3ba54dd3e84583ff7e3e104efc5fa24ab721b
Implements: blueprint heat-rolling-upgrades

commit_message:
Migrate to use glance v2

Now glance v1 is deprecated, and even in devstack the
default version of glance is v2, this blueprint will migrate
to use glance v2, and will make image resource compatible
with old template.

Change-Id: I80ca7131a705e08925588cb2b92e4a75cd5c8242
Blueprint: migrate-to-glance-v2

commit_message:
Release Monasca

* monasca-agent        2.7.0
* monasca-api          2.6.0
* monasca-ceilometer   1.8.0
* monasca-common       2.9.0
* monasca-persister    1.11.0
* monasca-statsd       1.10.0
* monasca-thresh       2.3.0
* monasca-transform    0.15.0
* monasca-ui           1.13.0
* python-monascaclient 1.11.0

Change-Id: Ibaf8c2a51491d72f8e831f9482ab6897fe2df73b

commit_message:
tests: Do not always fetch the get-pip.py script during tests

Since we are testing the idempotence of this role, we shouldn't
fetch the get-pip.py script on every iteration so we set the variable
to 'false'. Moreover, we bump the PIP version to 9.0.3 since this is
what is currently being deployed on the hosts. Finally, get-pip.py
uses --force-reinstall by default which means that everything is being
reinstalled all the time and this breaks idempotence. We can fix that by
simply checking if a suitable version of PIP is installed and then use
it to do a proper upgrade.

Change-Id: I998182eca9851d2cc745930fc73ca37bfefd0951

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-09 19:09:16.000000000', 'message': 'Force pip install update of PasteDeploy

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial job is
currently failing at a rate of 100% since we updated to use the Pike
UCA. The Ceph packages in the Pike UCA are pulling in python-paste and
python-pastedeploy. When devstack pip installs a newer version of
python-paste to satisfy upper-constraints, we end up with Paste
installed from pypi and python-pastedeploy installed from the Ubuntu
archive and Keystone fails to start with the error:

  "ImportError: cannot import name deploy."

This adds a hack to force an update of PasteDeploy from pypi during the
devstack "stack install" phase to work around the problem and get the
job passing again.

Change-Id: Idf28de8faa56c2d387291c7d14ac6d4bf1c74c6a
'}]
commit_message:
Force pip install update of PasteDeploy

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial job is
currently failing at a rate of 100% since we updated to use the Pike
UCA. The Ceph packages in the Pike UCA are pulling in python-paste and
python-pastedeploy. When devstack pip installs a newer version of
python-paste to satisfy upper-constraints, we end up with Paste
installed from pypi and python-pastedeploy installed from the Ubuntu
archive and Keystone fails to start with the error:

  "ImportError: cannot import name deploy."

This adds a hack to force an update of PasteDeploy from pypi during the
devstack "stack install" phase to work around the problem and get the
job passing again.

Change-Id: Idf28de8faa56c2d387291c7d14ac6d4bf1c74c6a

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ieff5b69018e3824074b5a528a7b9d2a00dd7fb2e

commit_message:
Deprecating transformers and pipeline partitioning

Theses features doesn't work well, rate-of-change metrics can still
wrongly be computed even with Pipeline partioning enabled. Also backend
like Gnocchi offers a better alternative to compute them.

This deprecates these two features, to be able to remove them in a couple
of releases.

Change-Id: I52362c69b7d500bfe6dba76f78403a9d376deb80

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 12:05:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add "Manual" Tiering Feature

As preparation for auto tiering feature, this patch add "manual"
tiering feature to swift. With tiering feature, we can change
storage policy of objects with transparent accesses to them.

This patch enables tiered storage policy. Tiered storage policy
has some candidate storage policies to objects stored in.
The candidate policies are called "derivative" policies.

If you send PUT or POST request to an object in tiered policy
with "X-Tier-Move-To: <derivative policy name>" header,
object-tiering daemons (new daemon addded in this patch) move the
object to hidden container with the derivative policy and PUT
a kind of special symlink to the original object path for transparent
GET or HEAD.

The special symlink supports POST request and the new metadata will be
merged into moved objects when GET or HEAD. So we can update metadata
of tiered objects transparently.

If you send overwriting-PUT or DELETE request to the special symlink,
the result will be propagated to the moved object automatically. So we
can update tiered objects transparently.

Even if object-tiering daemons PUT special symlinks, etag and size
in container DB is not changed. So we can use HEAD or GET result from
containers or accounts transparently. Of course, we can use container
or account quota transparently too.

Existing proxy middelwares also obtains transparent access to tiered
objects. So we can use the middelwares without any change.

This feature uses general task queue feature, so we can obtain scalable
throughput of object moving.

Change-Id: I40de1a35270f09884ff5ebc7afcb1e9b35c2c910

commit_message:
WIP: Add "Manual" Tiering Feature

As preparation for auto tiering feature, this patch add "manual"
tiering feature to swift. With tiering feature, we can change
storage policy of objects with transparent accesses to them.

This patch enables "tiered storage policy". Tiered storage policy
has some candidate storage policies to objects stored in.
The candidate policies are called "derivative policies".

If you send PUT or POST request to an object in tiered policy
with "X-Tier-Move-To: <derivative policy name>" header,
object-tiering daemons (new daemon addded in this patch) move the
object to hidden account with the derivative policy and PUT
a kind of special symlink to the original object path for transparent
GET or HEAD.

The special symlink supports POST request and the new metadata will be
merged into moved objects when GET or HEAD. So we can update metadata
of tiered objects transparently.

If you send overwriting-PUT or DELETE request to the special symlink,
the result will be propagated to the moved object automatically. So we
can update tiered objects transparently.

Even if object-tiering daemons PUT special symlinks, etag and size
in container DB is not changed. So we can use HEAD or GET result from
containers or accounts transparently. Of course, we can use container
or account quota transparently too.

Existing proxy middelwares also obtains transparent access to tiered
objects. So we can use the middelwares without any change.

This feature uses general task queue feature, so we can obtain scalable
throughput of object moving.

Change-Id: I40de1a35270f09884ff5ebc7afcb1e9b35c2c910

This changes _ACTIVATION_TIMEOUT of LBaaS driver from constant to
configurable value in order to make it flexible to production
environment.

This commit also increases the timeout value in DevStack plugin to make
sure Octavia has time to run Amphorae in the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I895d3e5af71ccc7219be422b9ca9e9f8833bad8f

commit_message:
Make Neutron LBaaS Activation Timeout configurable

This changes _ACTIVATION_TIMEOUT of LBaaS driver from constant to
configurable value in order to make it flexible to production
environment.

This commit also increases the timeout value in DevStack plugin to make
sure Octavia has time to run Amphorae in the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I895d3e5af71ccc7219be422b9ca9e9f8833bad8f
Related-Bug: 1753653
Signed-off-by: Eunsoo Park <esevan.park@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch to config-download by default

--config-download is now defaulted to True. Since the mappings from
config-download-environment.yaml must be used with config-download,
that environment file is included by default as well.

Once https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558927/ has landed that makes the
config-download mappings the default in tripleo-heat-templates we can
remove adding the environment file from tripleoclient.

--no-config-download is added to disable config-download but is
deprecated.

implements: blueprint config-download-default
Change-Id: I05593f81d567d35c931a0ac4e70fa8000dd458ec

commit_message:
Fixing stackviz generation

Stackviz is failing in multinode container because tempest runs as root,
so all the result files are created with root as owner, so when stackviz
tries to access these files, got a permission error. This patch set the
owner back to undercloud_user for tempest directory

Change-Id: Ia3b3dd4688a8d20c3750d299136211acc5a5db82

commit_message:
Dockerfiles: COPY code after installing packages

This change moves COPY directive in kuryr-controller.Dockerfile to be
executed after all the required packages are installed through yum. With
it a layer with all the packages installed can be reused when rebuilding
the image with only Kuryr code changes. This makes development easier
and faster as `yum install` is the longest process during building the
docker image.

Change-Id: I94a7401e393d9c8e51ab50967de792aeae15f811

commit_message:
Devstack deployment - handle LoadBalancer creation failure

During Devstack deployment a Load Balancer is created
to allows pods that need access to Kubernetes API  to talk
to the K8s API service.
In case of Load Balancer's 'provisioning_status' not set to
'ACTIVE' for any reason the deployment is stuck forever,
 this patch adds maximum timeout for LoadBalancer's status verification.

Change-Id: I735b87ea3b243421fb83189b6de7df8ce17cbf7c
Closes-Bug: 1760885

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 13:25:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes binding type for OpenDaylight Websocket

For OpenDaylight Websocket connections we were not using transparent
binding type with HA Proxy.  This means that HA Proxy was not able to
start on nodes that did not have the VIP because it was unable to bind
to that IP on more than one node.  However, transparent binding works OK
with OpenDaylight Websocket and should be fine to enable so that HA
Proxy is able to start on every controller.

Closes-Bug: 1764514

Change-Id: I89e6115795ece6735e816ab71b5b552b17f7b943
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 70bedeef99d5b2852307158330f78c0d9159532f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes binding type for OpenDaylight Websocket

For OpenDaylight Websocket connections we were not using transparent
binding type with HA Proxy.  This means that HA Proxy was not able to
start on nodes that did not have the VIP because it was unable to bind
to that IP on more than one node.  However, transparent binding works OK
with OpenDaylight Websocket and should be fine to enable so that HA
Proxy is able to start on every controller.

Closes-Bug: 1764514

Change-Id: I89e6115795ece6735e816ab71b5b552b17f7b943
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 70bedeef99d5b2852307158330f78c0d9159532f)

commit_message:
Create CNI bin dir in OpenShift DevStack plugin

In case of containerized deployment we haven't been creating
$CNI_BIN_DIR directory. This made containerized deployments with
OpenShift to fail. This commit solves that by adding `mkdir` just before
the directory is needed as OpenShift installation should not depend on
Kuryr installation.

Change-Id: Iea797939fdb8dc6f0db4a4f128075b94f85c8073
Closes-Bug: 1759153

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 16:26:16.000000000', 'message': "Add HTTPS support to K8s API healthchecks

Our Controller and CNI healthchecks are checking the connection to the
K8s API. This is done using the requests library directly and not
through K8sClient wrapper. Because of that we've forgot to add HTTPS
support there (DevStack runs K8s with HTTP).

This commit fix that by making /healthz requests to go through
K8sClient wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d2657dfb123a7641eb838d7ddecde769bbb4318
Closes-Bug: 1759293
(cherry picked from commit 71ce161d611537dfaa5b51afd325ecbe102b8d4a)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 08:19:47.000000000', 'message': "Add HTTPS support to K8s API healthchecks

This is done using the requests library directly and not through
K8sClient wrapper. Because of that we've forgot to add HTTPS support
there (DevStack runs K8s with HTTP).

This commit fix that by making /healthz requests to go through
K8sClient wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d2657dfb123a7641eb838d7ddecde769bbb4318
Closes-Bug: 1759293
(cherry picked from commit 71ce161d611537dfaa5b51afd325ecbe102b8d4a)
"}]
commit_message:
Add HTTPS support to K8s API healthchecks

Our Controller healthchecks are checking the connection to the K8s API.
This is done using the requests library directly and not through
K8sClient wrapper. Because of that we've forgot to add HTTPS support
there (DevStack runs K8s with HTTP).

This commit fix that by making /healthz requests to go through
K8sClient wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d2657dfb123a7641eb838d7ddecde769bbb4318
Closes-Bug: 1759293
(cherry picked from commit 71ce161d611537dfaa5b51afd325ecbe102b8d4a)

commit_message:
heat-launcher: enable convergence

We enabled convergence in previous releases for non containerized
undercloud, we should re-enable it for containerized undercloud for
parity and use convergence's features.

Change-Id: I7b5059bad9570dedb0e8fc69aa0e3a17f87e00bd

commit_message:
Kuryr controller - pluggable handlers documentation

Starting with the Rocky release, Kuryr-Kubernetes will include a
pluggable interface for the Kuryr controller handlers.
This patch updates the documentation to include this capability.

Partially Implements: kuryr-pluggable-handlers

Change-Id: I908b5f52d2e2dfe3432ec95e34b04c1d28c21917

commit_message:
Apply UC to Dockerfiles

Upper constraints weren't applied to the Dockerfiles installation so
pip install deps when over it. This commit fixes it by defining a new
env var for it and passit it to pip.

Closes-Bug: #1763752
Change-Id: Id126fee033db6f150ad95c94682eb56b4b2cea03
(cherry picked from commit 2ed3923a0a8f9d6339bbbe87b555e1b760ef5f31)

commit_message:
Convert remaining check ovb jobs to config-download

As we move towards making config-download the default, this converts the
remaining ovb jobs in the check queue that run against master changes to
use config-download.

Once it's the default, we can come back and update these configs to not
have to explicitly use --config-download.

This also updates the feature configuration doc to indicate these ovb
jobs and the multinode jobs from the previous patch now use
config-download.

Change-Id: Ib0c0ba67e13f0978017f67dfc6095221d79b244c
implements: blueprint config-download-default

[{'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I just ran into this issue on an Ocata deployment. It looks like Sean's patch for 1705340 landed without issue during the Pike beta stage, but was never backported to stable/ocata. Considering it's a clean one-line cherry-pick, I'm taking the liberty to just submit it; I hope that's OK. I'm also linking an older, related bug that people are slightly more likely to find on LP when they google for the error message."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:43:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/562145/1/ : FAILURE in 1h 21m 02s'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You seem to have done a backport of change:

    commit 011ae614d5c5fb35b2e9c22a9c4c99158f6aee20
    Author: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
    Date:   Mon Jul 24 10:51:49 2017 -0400

        Increase cpu time for image conversion

        [...]

Please make a clean cherry-pick, with `git cherry-pick -x` so that you get "cherry picked from commit" references.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@kashyap done; should I put the Related-Bug addition back in or do you prefer for it to be left out?'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> @kashyap done; should I put the Related-Bug addition back in or do
 > you prefer for it to be left out?

I think it's OK to be left out.  Unless you strongly prefer it.

I'm fine with this backport, I don't recall top off my head what the stable branch "policy" for Ocata is.  But tn this case, regardless of what the policy is, this change should be accepted.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I'm fine with this backport, I don't recall top off my head what
 > the stable branch "policy" for Ocata is.  But tn this case,
 > regardless of what the policy is, this change should be accepted.

Right, the prior limit is definitely a bug, and it does break things in a way where (a) there is no fix available to the user, short of using a smaller image, and (b) there is also no fix available to the cloud operator, short of buying faster storage or hot-patching Nova. All of which creates pain. :)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-18 11:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/562145/2/ : FAILURE in 1h 21m 02s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-18 19:51:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'm OK with this, and with extended maintenance [1] around the corner it should be fine.

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#maintenance-phases"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Maybe we should add a configure option for this.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To Alex' comment, making this configurable has been considered before when the limit had to be raised from 2 to 8, and was rejected at the time (see https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1646181/comments/12). Not sure if public opinion has changed in the interim."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-04-20 08:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Increase cpu time for image conversion

Apparently the current 8 second timeout on qemu-info may not be
sufficient if snapshot images are > 120G in size.

This bumps that to 30s instead to provide a backstop, but not hurt
people with large snapshots.

Change-Id: I877b9401a671904a13bb07bae3636b72d7d20df8
Closes-Bug: #1705340
(cherry picked from commit 011ae614d5c5fb35b2e9c22a9c4c99158f6aee20)

commit_message:
Handle spawning error on unshelving

If spawning fails when unshelving, terminate the volumes' connections
with the node, and remove the node reference from the instance entry.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts are due to the following changes not in Ocata:

  I2394b0588bc7210efd16456af2fc12dc7071681c

  Id2c7b7b3b4abda8a3b878fdee6806bcfe096e12e

  I3a3caa4c566ecc132aa2699f8c7e5987bbcc863a

Closes-Bug: 1627694
Change-Id: I8cfb2280d956d452ccad1fc711bd814b7258147f
(cherry picked from commit dcdd2c9832c7c60fe9163cd744ca2b5acfe16bcc)
(cherry picked from commit 73c3e4969c108f2eefc77b57021d9b3e17afdc8e)
(cherry picked from commit 06946b7f8ad310e01eff895362ad0f3a164636f5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 17:11:37.000000000', 'message': 'Set the pypiserver root to the correct directory

The folder from which pypiserver will serve the wheels that are
pre-built in the repo-build process was incorrectly set, resulting
in pypiserver never, ever serving the wheels but instead always
forwarding on to the nginx reverse proxy to fetch things from
pypi.

Now that the root folder is correctly set, two things will happen:

* Wheels will be served from pypi, negating the need to use the
  pip_links, so [1] should pass once this merges.
* Once the repo build is complete, the packages available to
  install will be restricted properly to only the packages
  built by the repo build process.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/549012

Change-Id: I16706d399f6b026a6d0004fd07e5f18605a7b5db
(cherry picked from commit 3e247f6f5710079dbe8147c0f0c0f4f6fc34fd81)
'}]
commit_message:
Set the pypiserver root to the correct directory

The folder from which pypiserver will serve the wheels that are
pre-built in the repo-build process was incorrectly set, resulting
in pypiserver never, ever serving the wheels but instead always
forwarding on to the nginx reverse proxy to fetch things from
pypi.

Now that the root folder is correctly set, two things will happen:

* Wheels will be served from pypi, negating the need to use the
  pip_links, so [1] should pass once this merges.
* Once the repo build is complete, the packages available to
  install will be restricted properly to only the packages
  built by the repo build process.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/549012

Change-Id: I16706d399f6b026a6d0004fd07e5f18605a7b5db
(cherry picked from commit 3e247f6f5710079dbe8147c0f0c0f4f6fc34fd81)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 15:18:51.000000000', 'message': 'lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30
Closes-Bug: #1763045
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 285456a672ae8fe9276055374efa3fde90929b9d)

commit_message:
lbaasv2: Fix for deployments missing the proxy

When Octavia stopped needing neutron-lbaasv2 devstack plugin we tried it
out with success but we still kept usage the plugin so that our devstack
plugin could target older than pike.

Unfortunately during this time the proxy became unnecessary and not well
maintained and due to our gates still using it, when we tried queens
with the supported proxy less Octavia we realized that it fails.

This patch addresses it by making the existing neutronclient usage point
to the load-balancer endpoint when the proxy is not in place.

Change-Id: Iafd74f23bdf336a4d78ba4759f702cf989c8bc30
Closes-Bug: #1763045
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
(cherry picked from commit 285456a672ae8fe9276055374efa3fde90929b9d)

commit_message:
Ensure security of etcd connection

The code assumes that etc.tls.available has been set; however that
might not be the case so guard the configuration of vault to use
etcd to check for this flag before adding etcd configuration.

Change-Id: I52f6fb2db309564634ba1698bd7905b2c1e8ceeb

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages. Even then, this is
the client install and doesn't use percona anyway.

Change-Id: I9a9f877e818c94954e7fb3e86edef7295c51d2e2

commit_message:
Remove perl library from Ubuntu installs

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages. Even then, this is
the client install and doesn't use percona anyway.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/238748

Change-Id: I9a9f877e818c94954e7fb3e86edef7295c51d2e2
(cherry picked from commit 2d81894b068a1e010ab4b95955d4eb67208ed176)

commit_message:
usage: move field-specific logic from template to code

_limit_summary.html has field-specific logic in the template,
but it is better to have such logic in python code so that
we can make the limit summary more pluggable in future.

In addition, filters for ram and volume gigabytes are applied
only when quota is not unlimited. This commit also fixes it.

blueprint make-quotas-great-again
Change-Id: I4c9584431c2526ebecf6d1438c1bf0e44f70a493

'}, {'created': '2018-04-19 11:36:18.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries)

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42

commit_message:
Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42

messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-20 04:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 04:29:07.000000000', 'message': "Add '__task_execution' structure to task execution context on the fly

* Previously we stored the data structure describing the current
  task execution (id and name) in the inbound task execution context
  directly so that it'd be saved to DB. This was needed to evaluate
  YAQL/Jinja function task() without parameters properly. However,
  it's not needed, we can just build a context view on the fly
  just before evaluating an expression.

Change-Id: If523039446ab3e2ccc9542617de2a170168f6e20
Closes-Bug: #1764704
(cherry picked from commit 6b7b58ed6c9dcad1a4db07586ea299bf01661523)
"}]
commit_message:
Add '__task_execution' structure to task execution context on the fly

* Previously we stored the data structure describing the current
  task execution (id and name) in the inbound task execution context
  directly so that it'd be saved to DB. This was needed to evaluate
  YAQL/Jinja function task() without parameters properly. However,
  it's not needed, we can just build a context view on the fly
  just before evaluating an expression.

Change-Id: If523039446ab3e2ccc9542617de2a170168f6e20
Closes-Bug: #1764704
(cherry picked from commit 6b7b58ed6c9dcad1a4db07586ea299bf01661523)

commit_message:
usage: Use tenant_quota_usages() for Limit Summary

Previously we have almost duplicated logic for the limit summary
and quota usages. This commit shares the logic.

blueprint make-quotas-great-again

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 20:56:16.000000000', 'message': 'ZFSSA accept pool stats when cluster node stripped

When a node in a ZFSSA cluster fails, storage pools and network
interfaces associated with it get "taken over" by the other node. In
this scenario, the identity of the node does not match the "owner" of
the pool. Currently, the cinder volume drivers consider this to be a
failure. With this change, it will not be considered a failure, so long
as the cluster node is stripped. If the cluster is operating normally,
the node responding to API requests must be the node that owns the pool.

Change-Id: I073cf97bc65f93acd5732c9b7072c7130e6b248f
Closes-Bug: 1762777
(cherry picked from commit 28b9d2eeef69ac979c5f5e1160643f73faf157a4)
'}]
commit_message:
ZFSSA accept pool stats when cluster node stripped

When a node in a ZFSSA cluster fails, storage pools and network
interfaces associated with it get "taken over" by the other node. In
this scenario, the identity of the node does not match the "owner" of
the pool. Currently, the cinder volume drivers consider this to be a
failure. With this change, it will not be considered a failure, so long
as the cluster node is stripped. If the cluster is operating normally,
the node responding to API requests must be the node that owns the pool.

Change-Id: I073cf97bc65f93acd5732c9b7072c7130e6b248f
Closes-Bug: 1762777
(cherry picked from commit 28b9d2eeef69ac979c5f5e1160643f73faf157a4)

commit_message:
Handle libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags option

This allows for specifying granular CPU feature flags when specifying
CPU models.
It should be set only if 'cpu_mode' and 'cpu_model' attributes are set
and cpu_mode attribute value is set to "custom".

NOTE: The related nova changes are done in change:
I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44

Change-Id: Id4f2cad2e0b0c34a7a68d0b3a6f69b44816f4cd9

commit_message:
Make Neutron LBaaS Activation Timeout configurable

This changes _ACTIVATION_TIMEOUT of LBaaS driver from constant to
configurable value in order to make it flexible to production
environment.

This commit also increases the timeout value in DevStack plugin to make
sure Octavia has time to run Amphorae in the gate.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I895d3e5af71ccc7219be422b9ca9e9f8833bad8f
Related-Bug: 1753653
Signed-off-by: Eunsoo Park <esevan.park@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Render crush-initial-weight option if set to 0

Fixes the conditional in the ceph.conf template so it renders the
crush-initial-weight config option if set to 0.

Change-Id: Iaecbdf52bd3731effa3132e61364918407116dbe
Closes-Bug: 1764077
(cherry picked from commit 5ea1973062a55af4d5c41da226d3d110b2b85ff6)

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-20 08:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-04-20 08:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-04-20 08:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-20 09:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit f703ba3bb56c8573f46538a643e0067b91f1043b'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 07:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove perl library from Ubuntu installs

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages. Even then, this is
the client install and doesn't use percona anyway.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/238748

Change-Id: I9a9f877e818c94954e7fb3e86edef7295c51d2e2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove perl library from Ubuntu installs

It seems that the package was added a long time ago [1], and might
have been needed for the percona tooling. This makes sense if we're
downloading the dep - but we're no longer doing that and can rely
on apt's resolver to find the correct packages. Even then, this is
the client install and doesn't use percona anyway.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/238748

Change-Id: I9a9f877e818c94954e7fb3e86edef7295c51d2e2

commit_message:
Drop pointless PIP packages

Nothing in the role requires the MySQL-python package so we can simply
drop it to simplify the role.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: Id9dd2dea146709414ab9ce8d439f1587e6776fd4

[{'created': '2018-04-16 04:48:14.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OS::Neutron::Port in subnode template

Using OS::Neutron::Port directly just to associate a floating IP is
strongly discouraged because the scheduling of the server becomes
constrained by the existing port.

Instead, let nova/neutron create the port implicitly and fetch the
resulting port ID to use for the floating IP association.

This may improve the success rate of multinode jobs where nodes go to
ERROR due to schedule failures, but I'm not aware of any specific bug
which is tracking this.

Change-Id: Ie5cdd5a465040a0ece98a6103ad60b4a26610e42
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 22:12:18.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OS::Neutron::Port in subnode template

Using OS::Neutron::Port directly just to associate a floating IP is
strongly discouraged because the scheduling of the server becomes
constrained by the existing port.

Instead, let nova/neutron create the port implicitly and fetch the
resulting port ID to use for the floating IP association.

This change also adds a depends_on:router_interface to ensure the
interface exists before floating IPs attempt to use it.

This may improve the success rate of multinode jobs where nodes go to
ERROR due to schedule failures, but I'm not aware of any specific bug
which is tracking this.

Change-Id: Ie5cdd5a465040a0ece98a6103ad60b4a26610e42
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use OS::Neutron::Port in subnode template

Using OS::Neutron::Port directly just to associate a floating IP is
strongly discouraged because the scheduling of the server becomes
constrained by the existing port.

Instead, let nova/neutron create the port implicitly and fetch the
resulting port ID to use for the floating IP association.

This change also adds a depends_on:router_interface to ensure the
interface exists before floating IPs attempt to use it.

This may improve the success rate of multinode jobs where nodes go to
ERROR due to schedule failures, but I'm not aware of any specific bug
which is tracking this.

Change-Id: Ie5cdd5a465040a0ece98a6103ad60b4a26610e42

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: If934acbcfe81578366d1ecc0c5fec7c6de5b2040
Partial-Bug: #1741634

Resync charms.ceph to pickup improvements in recording
of block devices that have been processed as OSD devices
to support better idempotency of block device processing
codepaths.

This fixes a particularly nasty issue with osd-reformat
is set to True where the charm can wipe and re-prepare
an OSD device prior to the systemd unit actually booting
and mounting the OSD's associated filesystem.

This change also enables syncing charms.ceph from the
stable/18.02 branch.

Change-Id: I3b09a0c49ea212c31f5a22613e359542600eefe7
"}]
commit_message:
Improve idempotency of block device processing

Resync charms.ceph to pickup improvements in recording
of block devices that have been processed as OSD devices
to support better idempotency of block device processing
codepaths.

This fixes a particularly nasty issue with osd-reformat
is set to True where the charm can wipe and re-prepare
an OSD device prior to the systemd unit actually booting
and mounting the OSD's associated filesystem.

This change also enables syncing charms.ceph from the
stable/18.02 branch.

Change-Id: I3b09a0c49ea212c31f5a22613e359542600eefe7

Pushing it further back will make it easier to manage and generally conflict less with forum/summit prep."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-10 21:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-04-10 21:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

From an election operations perspective, I believe this makes essentially no difference, especially with several months of notice to prepare.  I would fear making the election much earlier than this, as I do not think nominations should start until PTG+2, and it takes about three weeks for a TC election (nomination period, campaigning period, voting period).  This change would require 11 weeks between PTG and Summit, which seems reasonable to me (while still allowing some flexibility for venue scheduling).   S-5 might offer a bit more flexibility, and I think S-8 would run into issues with having enough weeks in a year.

Given the difficulties of organising travel, I personally agree that three weeks is too tight.  One ought book travel at least three weeks in advance, and two weeks does not seem extreme in terms of ensuring authorisation for travel, making an S-5 or S-6 result much easier for those whose travel approvals may depend on election results.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Completely agree! Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-04-13 00:01:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The only downside I see in this is negates some of the separation that was the motivation for holding the TC and PTL elections separated.

The PTL election is at R-3 and if we move the TC election to S-6 which moves the space between PTL and TC election to ~4 weeks which *may* make it harder to adjust tooling etc for the officials, and means that election officials are focused on the election for a larger chunk of time

I don't have a strong opinion here but it's certainly an aspect to consider."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The only downside I see in this is negates some of the separation
 > that was the motivation for holding the TC and PTL elections
 > separated.
 > 
 > The PTL election is at R-3 and if we move the TC election to S-6
 > which moves the space between PTL and TC election to ~4 weeks which
 > *may* make it harder to adjust tooling etc for the officials, and
 > means that election officials are focused on the election for a
 > larger chunk of time
 > 
 > I don't have a strong opinion here but it's certainly an aspect to
 > consider.

That's a good point, Tony.

We know we're going to have a set of PTL elections and a TC election every cycle. Maybe instead of organizing the tools to run one election at a time, we should organize them to let us run one of each election type per cycle? That way we wouldn't have to adjust the tools each cycle, we would just reset both elections when we prepare for the PTL election and we'd be ready to go."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-04-13 03:02:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> We know we're going to have a set of PTL elections and a TC
 > election every cycle. Maybe instead of organizing the tools to run
 > one election at a time, we should organize them to let us run one
 > of each election type per cycle? That way we wouldn't have to
 > adjust the tools each cycle, we would just reset both elections
 > when we prepare for the PTL election and we'd be ready to go.

It's less about reseting the tools which is mostly just editing a yaml file.  I was thinking more about accommodating feedback and tweaking tools/process recent examples include, adding the campaigning period to the TC and switching to using the OSF member db for extended metadata on candidates.

It's also true that at some level the election officials change/self manage based on the election type (for example, I'm not an official during PTL elections)

We're working on reducing manual intervention with things like[1].  Most of the motivation to fix the tools happens around/between elections.  I'm by no means suggesting we should let the tools define what works in our community I just wanted to make sure that part of things was considered.


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560741/ [2]
[2] Thanks for the pointers in getting that working"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-13 08:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cd/six-week-gap to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-13 08:34:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

We'll need 2/3 of members (9 members) to approve this as this is a charter change"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-04-13 15:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Agreed this is better for travel planning as well as other slow-moving approvals.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-14 05:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Majority reached, will be approved on Friday unless new objections are posted.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-04-17 12:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

While it doesn't impact me, if it helps newcomers to the TC get employer clearance to travel to the conference then it seems like a net win.

Note that in regards to the suggestions about coupling the PTL and TC elections from a timeline and tooling standpoint, the election officials _just_ got finished with the tooling overhaul needed to decouple them. I'd rather see them left uncoupled in our process and tooling for increased future flexibility, even if they'll be back to near proximity once more. If our various conferences get shifted around, we may end up wanting to revisit this decision after all."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-20 07:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 12:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust TC election target to 6 weeks before summit

The existing 3 weeks prior to summit target for TC elections can be
problematic for travel planning for candidates who might only go to
summit if they win their election, or might plan a different length
of trip depending on their role(s) in the community. This change
makes the target for the election to be six weeks prior to summit
to ease that planning.

In addition to helping with travel concerns, it also means that any
newly elected TC members will be more involved in planning for the
forum at the summit.

If approved this change would go in effect for the second election
in 2018. The first election of 2018 is already scheduled.

Change-Id: Ie1a7d9bae28864fb7413d8df2daa67abc5c70778
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust TC election target to 6 weeks before summit

The existing 3 weeks prior to summit target for TC elections can be
problematic for travel planning for candidates who might only go to
summit if they win their election, or might plan a different length
of trip depending on their role(s) in the community. This change
makes the target for the election to be six weeks prior to summit
to ease that planning.

In addition to helping with travel concerns, it also means that any
newly elected TC members will be more involved in planning for the
forum at the summit.

If approved this change would go in effect for the second election
in 2018. The first election of 2018 is already scheduled.

Change-Id: Ie1a7d9bae28864fb7413d8df2daa67abc5c70778

commit_message:
Force stunnel to use TLSv1.2

This allows us to force a TLS version for stunnel, which we
set to TLSv1.2. This ensures that we're compliant with FedRamp,
which requires a minimum version of TLSv1.1.

Unfortunately, using the "option" key didn't work in the configuration
as was tried in a previous commit. This option would have only only
disabled the versions we set, instead of only allowing one, like
"sslVersions" does. This seems to be the only alternative we have at
the moment.

Related-Bug: #1754368
Change-Id: I353f893ee5dcc265269704e23f65aa0460724078

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-09 13:42:40.000000000', 'message': "Set error state after failed evacuation

When evacuation fails with NoValidHost, the migration status remains
'accepted' instead of 'error'. This causes problem in case the compute
service starts up again and looks for evacuations with status 'accepted',
as it then removes the local instances for those evacuations even though
the instance was never actually evacuated to another host.

Change-Id: I06d78c744fa75ae5f34c5cfa76bc3c9460767b84

commit_message:
Set error state after failed evacuation

When evacuation fails with NoValidHost, the migration status remains
'accepted' instead of 'error'. This causes problem in case the compute
service starts up again and looks for evacuations with status 'accepted',
as it then removes the local instances for those evacuations even though
the instance was never actually evacuated to another host.

Conflicts:
      nova/conductor/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I6590f0eda4ec4996543ad40d8c2640b83fc3dd9d in Ocata.

Change-Id: I06d78c744fa75ae5f34c5cfa76bc3c9460767b84
Closes-Bug: #1713783
(cherry picked from commit a8ebf5f1aac080854704e27146e8c98b053c6224)
(cherry picked from commit a3f286f43d866cd343d26d9bafadecab1c225e4b)

commit_message:
Modify incorrect debug meaasge in _inject_data

It attempts to show inject_info but can not format by %(info)
correctly,so we can use string directly.

Change-Id: Ib9c67757e0b1d833cf722eb8dfcc47a4414b6fb6
Closes-Bug: #1729294
(cherry picked from commit 76a4e42e8bb98c8d5f30d8fef7b0fafd3976b626)
(cherry picked from commit 4402da85cd5fe03809989373b4670adc7beb40f0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 04:00:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test failure with pecan 1.3

Pecan has been updated to 1.3 [1] which failed the unit test.
The failure is due to the deserialization of mock object
(see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561825/ for details) but
the controller should return None instead of a mock object.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555891/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561825/

Change-Id: I6823d833df7aa363fe00b30189ff3024dc4181cd
Closes-Bug: #1754978
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test failure with pecan 1.3

Pecan has been updated to 1.3 [1] which failed the unit test.
The failure is due to the deserialization of mock object
(see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561825/ for details) but
the controller should return None instead of a mock object.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555891/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561825/

Change-Id: I6823d833df7aa363fe00b30189ff3024dc4181cd
Closes-Bug: #1754978

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 12:30:58.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Block swap volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens

Prior to Queens any attempt to swap between encrypted volumes would
result in unencrypted data being written to the new volume. This
unencrypted data would then be overwritten the next time the volume was
attached to an instance as Nova no longer identified the volume as
encrypted, resulting in the volume being reformatted.

This stable only change uses limited parts of the following changes to
block all swap_volume attempts with encrypted volumes prior to Queens
where this was resolved by Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18 and also
blocked when using QEMU to decrypt LUKS volumes by
Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1.

Ica323b87fa85a454fca9d46ada3677f18fe50022

The request context is provided to swap_volume in order to look up the
encryption metadata of a volume.

Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355

Attempts to swap from an encrypted volume are blocked with a
NotImplementedError exception raised.

I258127fdcd011ccec721d5ff62eb7f128f130336

Attempts to swap from an unencrypted volume to an encrypted volume are
also blocked with a NotImplementedError exception raised.

Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb

The serial of a volume is used as the id if connection_info for the
volume doesn't contain the volume_id key. Required to avoid bug #1746609.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to cinderv3 support for swap_volume being
present in stable/ocata via I4b8bd01f1ffe2640fe7313213bf853d2e1bef9dd.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: If12e7860baad2899380f06144a0270784a5466b8
(cherry picked from commit de86ee6fa74e3a0b522fa1b5328c59f18bfac7df)

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to cinderv3 support for swap_volume not
being present in stable/ocata via
I4b8bd01f1ffe2640fe7313213bf853d2e1bef9dd.
