commit_message:
Clean up volumes on boot failure

When instance fails to spawn, nova would just shutdown
the instance, during which volumes would be detached.
If not retry,  volumes created by the boot task would
be left. In fact, volumes should be cleaned up.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I877d8eff8d2fecde0cd16b01e80bff41bdb8d88a
Closes-Bug: #1699469
(cherry picked from commit 1a32bfd2ca1541af935b13b86728f124bba3d2c4)

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Add vHost management and improve security

This PS adds vhost management to rabbitmq jobs. It also prevents
sensitive information being displayed in the management job, and
removes the 'administrator' tag from service users.

Change-Id: Id337f763c5e4776bce7269676a8a2dc54dc2e5f8

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Id6433af376051c597aef163e916d607a36f4cfe4
Partial-Bug: #1764470

subject: Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String
messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-23 19:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Not merged in stable/queens yet.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-05 14:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-05 16:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-04-16 10:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-18 21:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-18 23:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 19:21:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String

When generating a random string, once we had selected from the various
required pools, we continued by selecting a pool at random and then
selecting a character from that pool at random. This did not take into
account the differing sizes of the available pools, nor the fact that the
same character could appear in multiple pools, which resulted in a
non-uniform probability distribution of characters. Since users mostly make
use of this feature to generate default passwords for services they are
deploying, this would result in the generated passwords having slightly
less entropy than expected (and pathological cases were possible).

Rectify this by always selecting non-constrained characters from a single
combined pool, and by ensuring that each character appears only once in any
pool we're selecting from.

Since we also want to use this method to generate passwords for OpenStack
Users, the new implementation is in a separate module in heat.common rather
than mixed in with the resource's logic. Also, use a StringIO object to
collect the characters rather than repeatedly appending to a string.

Change-Id: Ia7b63e72c1e3c0649290caf4fea8a32f7f89560b
Closes-Bug: #1757300

Related-Bug: #1444429

"}, {'created': '2018-04-05 16:44:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String

When generating a random string, once we had selected from the various
required pools, we continued by selecting a pool at random and then
selecting a character from that pool at random. This did not take into
account the differing sizes of the available pools, nor the fact that the
same character could appear in multiple pools, which resulted in a
non-uniform probability distribution of characters. Since users mostly make
use of this feature to generate default passwords for services they are
deploying, this would result in the generated passwords having slightly
less entropy than expected (and pathological cases were possible).

Rectify this by always selecting non-constrained characters from a single
combined pool, and by ensuring that each character appears only once in any
pool we're selecting from.

Since we also want to use this method to generate passwords for OpenStack
Users, the new implementation is in a separate module in heat.common rather
than mixed in with the resource's logic. Also, use a StringIO object to
collect the characters rather than repeatedly appending to a string.

Change-Id: Ia7b63e72c1e3c0649290caf4fea8a32f7f89560b
Closes-Bug: #1757300
Related-Bug: #1666129
Related-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 6e16c051ba9c2fc409c82fda19467d9ee1aaf484)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String

When generating a random string, once we had selected from the various
required pools, we continued by selecting a pool at random and then
selecting a character from that pool at random. This did not take into
account the differing sizes of the available pools, nor the fact that the
same character could appear in multiple pools, which resulted in a
non-uniform probability distribution of characters. Since users mostly make
use of this feature to generate default passwords for services they are
deploying, this would result in the generated passwords having slightly
less entropy than expected (and pathological cases were possible).

Rectify this by always selecting non-constrained characters from a single
combined pool, and by ensuring that each character appears only once in any
pool we're selecting from.

Since we also want to use this method to generate passwords for OpenStack
Users, the new implementation is in a separate module in heat.common rather
than mixed in with the resource's logic. Also, use a StringIO object to
collect the characters rather than repeatedly appending to a string.

Change-Id: Ia7b63e72c1e3c0649290caf4fea8a32f7f89560b
Closes-Bug: #1757300
Related-Bug: #1666129
Related-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 6e16c051ba9c2fc409c82fda19467d9ee1aaf484)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 12:23:42.000000000', 'message': "ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.


NOTE(sbauza) : Since I1bbfc152189252c5c45e6153695a802d17b76690 was also proposed and accepted for Pike, we need to backport the bugfix to that branch too.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)

commit_message:
ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
(cherry picked from commit ac20fc22adb133d9de5f2ec15faad11b2de1987a)
(cherry picked from commit 525ea3cfac0d91752bdac1bbca4191976d3c592a)

commit_message:
Updating the cli to work against kolla-ansible

Pass one at updating the kolla-cli to work against the official
kolla-ansible bits rather than the internal Oracle ones.  There
are some corresponding changes in the kolla-ansible vagrant
scripts related to bringing up the development environment.

Change-Id: Ia680bb65f904c4dbaf3f05d0334145980c860000
Implements: blueprint functional-single-node

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 03:33:30.000000000', 'message': 'Implemented all the APIs specified in cyborg-fpga-model-proposal
Added table Attribute
Added Objects physical_function and virtual_function
Added foreign key constrain for deployable to accelerator
Added an API deployable_get_by_filters
Added coresponding unit test for all of the changes

How to use:

physical_function maintains a virtual_function_list
On reporting, please do
    pf.add_vf(vf1)
    pf.add_vf(vf2)
    pf.save(context)

One retrieving, please do
    objects.PhysicalFunction.get(self.context, pf_uuid)
All the vf belong to this pf is in virtual_function_list

To retrieve deployables based on a query, please do:
        query = {"parent_uuid": pf_uuid}
        db_vf_list = dbapi.deployable_get_by_filters(context,
                                                     query)

What might be broken:
Since now there is a foreign key constrain in deployable
please make sure accelerator_id is set when saving deployables
Otherwise, exception will be thrown.

What is still missing:
Complete the relationship between deployable and attributes

Change-Id: Ie0153038e367782a81e2956d50a9cd15c5bc2a7b
'}, {'created': '2018-03-14 03:47:37.000000000', 'message': 'Implemented all the APIs specified in cyborg-fpga-model-proposal

commit_message:
Implemented the Objects and APIs for vf/pf

Added table Attribute
Added Objects physical_function and virtual_function
Added foreign key constrain for deployable to accelerator
Added an API deployable_get_by_filters
Added coresponding unit test for all of the changes

How to use:

physical_function maintains a virtual_function_list
On reporting, please do
    pf.add_vf(vf1)
    pf.add_vf(vf2)
    pf.save(context)

One retrieving, please do
    objects.PhysicalFunction.get(self.context, pf_uuid)
All the vf belong to this pf is in virtual_function_list

To retrieve deployables based on a query, please do:
    query = {"vendor": "Xilinx"}
    # Gives all the physical functions whose vendors are "Xilinx"
    pf_list = objects.PhysicalFunction.get_by_filter(self.context,
                                                     query)
    # Gives all the virtual functions whose vendors are "Xilinx"
    vf_list = objects.VirtualFunction.get_by_filter(self.context,
                                                    query)
    # Gives all the Deployables whose vendors are "Xilinx"
    # In this case, the list should contain all the above objects
    dpl_list = object.Deployable.get_by_filter(self.context,
                                               query)

What might be broken:
Since now there is a foreign key constrain in deployable
please make sure accelerator_id is set when saving deployables
Otherwise, exception will be thrown.

What is still missing:
Complete the relationship between deployable and attributes

Change-Id: Ie0153038e367782a81e2956d50a9cd15c5bc2a7b

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I982e042c472693ba73702b9be15438c1a0c045c2
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I0aa57fe2c7558cf2ffe9e1bb981036d8728ba42a
Partial-Bug: #1764470

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 09:08:20.000000000', 'message': "Run unittests under the low-constraints job

The low-constraints job should run unittests by the original desgin, we
didn't put the commands about running unittests inside the default
testenv settings, so in fact the low-constraints job did nothing except
creating a virtualenv.

This patch fixes and also move the unittests commands to the default
testenv settings like the other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ia344a14a9baf7574b043fc08332869083da6dc1e
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Run unittests under the low-constraints job

The low-constraints job should run unittests by the original desgin, we
didn't put the commands about running unittests inside the default
testenv settings, so in fact the low-constraints job did nothing except
creating a virtualenv.

This patch fixes and also move the unittests commands to the default
testenv settings like the other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ia344a14a9baf7574b043fc08332869083da6dc1e
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ceilometer-file-publisher-compression-csv-format

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/file-publisher-csv-format
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/file-publisher-compression

This is an enhancement of the existing file publisher within Ceilometer.
- 'compress=True" option is added to provide compression of files
  (within file rotation) to minimize disk usage and minimize bandwidth
  in transferring these files off server
- ‘format=csv’ option is added to the file publisher in order to
   enable CSV format

Change-Id: Ia3df0148272a358238f2f8cc1f76ff2fb2041ac6
Implements: blueprint file-publisher-csv-format
Implements: blueprint file-publisher-compression
Co-Authored-By: Al.Bailey@windriver.com
Co-Authored-By: Angie.Wang@windriver.com

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Iad3ed2fbc9840305498fa2dfffdcb39043b9abe8
Partial-Bug: #1764470

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 10:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Set the pypiserver root to the correct directory

The folder from which pypiserver will serve the wheels that are
pre-built in the repo-build process was incorrectly set, resulting
in pypiserver never, ever serving the wheels but instead always
forwarding on to the nginx reverse proxy to fetch things from
pypi.

Now that the root folder is correctly set, two things will happen:

* Wheels will be served from pypi, negating the need to use the
  pip_links, so [1] should pass once this merges.
* Once the repo build is complete, the packages available to
  install will be restricted properly to only the packages
  built by the repo build process.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/549012

Change-Id: I16706d399f6b026a6d0004fd07e5f18605a7b5db
'}]
commit_message:
Set the pypiserver root to the correct directory

The folder from which pypiserver will serve the wheels that are
pre-built in the repo-build process was incorrectly set, resulting
in pypiserver never, ever serving the wheels but instead always
forwarding on to the nginx reverse proxy to fetch things from
pypi.

Now that the root folder is correctly set, two things will happen:

* Wheels will be served from pypi, negating the need to use the
  pip_links, so [1] should pass once this merges.
* Once the repo build is complete, the packages available to
  install will be restricted properly to only the packages
  built by the repo build process.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/549012

Change-Id: I16706d399f6b026a6d0004fd07e5f18605a7b5db

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Ia3f2646bd3b5fa87c90c8dac57117fd29d73706b
(cherry picked from commit 4707422377214829126f1d6352119ea08a7ec104)

For example you could simply update https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/tests/rpc/test_server.py#n302 to use separate transports, one for the server and the other for the client."}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-08-31 19:45:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-31 14:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'Class-level _exchanges in FakeExchangeManager

The FakeExchangeManager uses an instance-level storage for FakeExchanges
mapping[1].  When a client--server pair is created, each keeps their own
instance of FakeDriver -> FakeExchangeManager -> FakeExchange, each of
which has their own (instance-level) copy of e.g _server_queues[2], making
it impossible for them to communicate.

This patch makes the _exchanges mapping a class-level attribute in order
to keep the registered exchanges shared between all Manager instances,
allowing client and server communication (within a single process).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L145,#L148
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L88,#L92

Change-Id: I8dff66f4cafeb1f4c57dbfbfaba5d49e50f55fee
Closes-Bug: #1714055
'}, {'created': '2017-09-05 15:36:50.000000000', 'message': 'Class-level _exchanges in FakeExchangeManager

The FakeExchangeManager uses an instance-level storage for FakeExchanges
mapping[1].  When a client--server pair is created, each keeps their own
instance of FakeDriver -> FakeExchangeManager -> FakeExchange, each of
which has their own (instance-level) copy of e.g _server_queues[2], making
it impossible for them to communicate.

This patch makes the _exchanges mapping a class-level attribute in order
to keep the registered exchanges shared between all Manager instances,
allowing client and server communication (within a single process).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L145,#L148
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L88,#L92

Change-Id: I8dff66f4cafeb1f4c57dbfbfaba5d49e50f55fee
Closes-Bug: #1714055

which has their own (instance-level) copy of e.g _server_queues[2], making
it impossible for them to communicate.

commit_message:
Class-level _exchanges in FakeExchangeManager

The FakeExchangeManager uses an instance-level storage for FakeExchanges
mapping[1].  When a client--server pair is created, each keeps their own
instance of FakeDriver -> FakeExchangeManager -> FakeExchange, each of
which has their own (instance-level) copy of e.g _server_queues[2], making
it impossible for them to communicate.

This patch makes the _exchanges mapping a class-level attribute in order
to keep the registered exchanges shared between all Manager instances,
allowing client and server communication (within a single process).

The test_server unit-tests had to be refactored to explicitly pass an exchange
name when building a target. This is required for an exchange name change to
have any effect during a test case run time when compared to passing the
exchange name through the URL. This issue was revealed with this patch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L145,#L148
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_fake.py#L88,#L92

Change-Id: I8dff66f4cafeb1f4c57dbfbfaba5d49e50f55fee
Closes-Bug: #1714055

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 21:00:48.000000000', 'message': 'Proper error handling by _ensure_resource_provider

Previously, if _ensure_resource_provider encountered any error from the
placement REST API, it would (sometimes log a message and) return None.

Furthermore, a name conflict while creating the provider was treated the
same as a UUID conflict, which would actually result in None being
returned.

With this change set, the error paths that previously returned None now
raise one of the new ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed or
ResourceProviderCreationFailed exceptions; and the name conflict path is
detected and treated as an error condition.

Note: This change set only touches the SchedulerReportClient side of
these error conditions - it makes no attempt to add error handling to
its callers.  Case in point, the API samples tests needed fixing because
they were previously running into the name conflict error condition, but
not noticing.  As currently implemented, the new exceptions will
percolate up to ComputeManager.update_available_resource_for_node like
any others coming from SchedulerReportClient, where they will be logged
and ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1735430
(cherry picked from commit 112cd9cd1f31e091920e2f55fb213f78152dfd37)

Conflicts:
	nova/scheduler/client/report.py
        - Log translation removal
        - ProviderTree integration
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py
        - ksa Adapter conversion
	nova/tests/functional/test_list_servers_ip_filter.py
        - Placement fixture needs to start before compute service

(cherry picked from commit 20531dbf89c77b6c63ad43285ccde20f176b6b23)

Conflicts:
  No 2.53 microversion in Ocata:
	doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/v2.53/hypervisors-detail-resp.json
	nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-hypervisors/v2.53/hypervisors-detail-resp.json.tpl
	nova/tests/functional/test_list_servers_ip_filter.py
	nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_hypervisors.py
  Return type changed, placement request ID not yet in logs:
	nova/scheduler/client/report.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36
'}]
commit_message:
Proper error handling by _ensure_resource_provider

Previously, if _ensure_resource_provider encountered any error from the
placement REST API, it would (sometimes log a message and) return None.

Furthermore, a name conflict while creating the provider was treated the
same as a UUID conflict, which would actually result in None being
returned.

With this change set, the error paths that previously returned None now
raise one of the new ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed or
ResourceProviderCreationFailed exceptions; and the name conflict path is
detected and treated as an error condition.

Note: This change set only touches the SchedulerReportClient side of
these error conditions - it makes no attempt to add error handling to
its callers.  Case in point, the API samples tests needed fixing because
they were previously running into the name conflict error condition, but
not noticing.  As currently implemented, the new exceptions will
percolate up to ComputeManager.update_available_resource_for_node like
any others coming from SchedulerReportClient, where they will be logged
and ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1735430
(cherry picked from commit 112cd9cd1f31e091920e2f55fb213f78152dfd37)

Conflicts:
	nova/scheduler/client/report.py
        - Log translation removal
        - ProviderTree integration
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py
        - ksa Adapter conversion
	nova/tests/functional/test_list_servers_ip_filter.py
        - Placement fixture needs to start before compute service

(cherry picked from commit 20531dbf89c77b6c63ad43285ccde20f176b6b23)

Conflicts:
  No 2.53 microversion in Ocata:
	doc/api_samples/os-hypervisors/v2.53/hypervisors-detail-resp.json
	nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-hypervisors/v2.53/hypervisors-detail-resp.json.tpl
	nova/tests/functional/test_list_servers_ip_filter.py
	nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_hypervisors.py
  Return type changed, placement request ID not yet in logs:
	nova/scheduler/client/report.py
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36

commit_message:
Zuul roles: allow to build only a specific image

Useful to generate a single image on-the-fly
and use it for scenario tests
(or simply useful for a refactor of the rest of the
build-images script).

Change-Id: Ica615e9e7d93b38fd12189a9f97d26ca62d84a3e

messages:
[{'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2018-04-16 04:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2018-04-16 04:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-16 06:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2018-04-16 09:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Hi Andreas,

Thanks for the review, I answered your first comment and fixed the second. I will upload the fix in the next patch set.

Thanks,

Ildikó"}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-18 04:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add best practices on structuring changes and handle patches

The change adds information about how to structure changes the best way.
It contains suggestions on patch size and content and also adds some notes
about patch chains and the usage of the Depends-On tag.

Story: 2001605
Task: 6564

Change-Id: I9cfa8c0baf1d17602667039d98d0da4b502e86ac

commit_message:
Disable FluentClient service for ffwd/upgrades.

FluentClient service has been renamed
into Fluentd [0] for queens. This patch
handles the disabling of the old FluentdClient
service.

[0] Idb9886f04d56ffc75a78c4059ff319b58b4acf9f

Change-Id: I085973f3d23fd78c16cba94a91692421956b301b
Closes-Bug: #1746493

commit_message:
sfc: Correctly handle BaGPipePortHops OVO in agent

Correctly handle BaGPipePortHops OVO to add lb_consistent_hash_order attribute
to chain hop details in port_info after SFC agent extension restart or
notification RPC.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Ideec1177b45b1ac7ab94a68a5266bc66b12326a2
Closes-Bug: 1758334

messages:
[{'account_id': 28011, 'date': '2018-04-06 22:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-06 22:21:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28011, 'date': '2018-04-06 22:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

commit_message:
add elasticsearch, fluent-logging, grafana registry endpoints

This adds the local image registry endpoint to elasticsearch,
fluent-logging and grafana.  This endpoint was missing from the
values.yaml in those charts

commit_message:
Fix MapR dependency on mysql on RHEL

MapR is missing mysql-java-connector and that makes it necessary to have
subscription enable on RHEL7

Change-Id: I1866ee0e21edd46773e67cb24654f00aadf8e39a
Story: #2001773

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:23:46.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I1271ff7dc7fd2ebc0327801cd97d62971ff82e94
Closes-Bug: #1762431
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: I1271ff7dc7fd2ebc0327801cd97d62971ff82e94
Closes-Bug: #1762431

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I8b40b4bceaf90fadecb4512c0cb9dbee143fe987
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Icc757ac36b298e46c0f257cd8304ac8553b85ee3
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Some style changes are included to make it easier to read,
the copyright notice is added as it should have been from
the start, and a duplicate retry argument is removed.

Change-Id: I11c3da84fa6469764a19b6a387ef312124dfba2a

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools with a script
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27143, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-18 16:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-19 15:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 2366c457ef454a25781a07318624b60c4784c979'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 10:12:08.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic37abfb14303b93dfc80398d6e37706a68135cb0
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic37abfb14303b93dfc80398d6e37706a68135cb0
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I39e64f29e794075ef303d3e1a2c0c1a6a18937b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470

'}, {'created': '2018-03-16 09:48:26.000000000', 'message': "BIOS Settings: Add DB API

Adds the following methods to DB API:

* create_bios_settings
* update_bios_settings
* get_bios_settings

Adds two exceptions:

* BIOSSettingAlreadyExists
* BIOSSettingNotFound

This patch also deletes BIOS setting records
associated with a node when it's destroyed.

Change-Id: Ibbca0a30baaae1e19e015b4dddbbac0189ff80ba
Partial-Bug: #1712032

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: Add DB API

Adds the following methods to DB API:

* create_bios_setting_list
* update_bios_setting_list
* delete_bios_setting
* get_bios_setting
* get_bios_setting_list

Adds two exceptions:

* BIOSSettingAlreadyExists
* BIOSSettingNotFound

This patch also deletes BIOS setting records
associated with a node when it's destroyed.

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibbca0a30baaae1e19e015b4dddbbac0189ff80ba
Story: #1712032

(10 comments)

Thanks James, this will be a nice improvement. I'm not convinced that minor upgrades are all that different from major upgrades - I'd prefer to use a single section for both and call out any differences (of which I think there are none)."}, {'account_id': 16704, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (10 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks James, this will be a nice improvement. I'm not convinced
 > that minor upgrades are all that different from major upgrades -
 > I'd prefer to use a single section for both and call out any
 > differences (of which I think there are none).

Well the main difference I'm hoping to highlight (I guess I need to word this differently ?) - minor upgrades you typically can do without updating kolla-ansible (it is enough simply to update the version of the docker images via the openstack_release property in globals.yml).

Major upgrades you cannot (in my view). The version of kolla-ansible itself must be upgraded in this case first. (since this is the only way to get all the new/correct upgrade tasks etc in place before moving up to next major release)

Agree this should be broken out and have separate operating and upgrade docs.

Perhaps a bit about dockerhub vs dedicated private registry is in order, I was just building off/expanding the upgrade section that was there to start off.

I'll do a few more updates here in this review for the time being.

Good idea re: etherpad !"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:11:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > (10 comments)
 > >
 > > Thanks James, this will be a nice improvement. I'm not convinced
 > > that minor upgrades are all that different from major upgrades -
 > > I'd prefer to use a single section for both and call out any
 > > differences (of which I think there are none).
 > 
 > Well the main difference I'm hoping to highlight (I guess I need to
 > word this differently ?) - minor upgrades you typically can do
 > without updating kolla-ansible (it is enough simply to update the
 > version of the docker images via the openstack_release property in
 > globals.yml).

While it may be possible to do that, I think we should still recommend users to upgrade kolla-ansible, even for minor upgrades. There may be bug fixes etc. to bring in. Otherwise we may as well stop bothering to release minor versions of kolla-ansible after the first..."}, {'account_id': 16704, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16704, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Yeah I'm not saying it's not a valid use case, I'm just saying we shouldn't be always skipping that step for minor upgrades. If it's optional, let's call that out."}, {'account_id': 16704, 'date': '2018-02-21 10:52:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

i.e. to update the docker images alone is likely to be more straight forward, than the case where an operator is having to also deal with upgrading kolla-ansible and everything that may entail."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-21 10:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-20 11:55:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update upgrade information in operating-kolla.rst

Added more information here to help when doing upgrades.

Differenciate a bit between a minor and major upgrade.

For example, in a minor upgrade, only the kolla version changes.
In a major upgrade, kolla-ansible is also upgraded.

Change-Id: I9ed4cb172726277f477750a1b34dd0b9f11cf64f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 13:54:57.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Determine the build number on the fly

openSUSE changed the way the base container tarballs are being named so
we need to parse the Dockerfile to find out which build is available
for download.

Change-Id: Ib64dcbc960df7d369d202ce8cf7bdc29b3ee0e0a
Link: https://github.com/openSUSE/docker-containers-build/issues/29
'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Determine the build number on the fly

openSUSE changed the way the base container tarballs are being named so
we need to parse the Dockerfile to find out which build is available
for download.

Change-Id: Ib64dcbc960df7d369d202ce8cf7bdc29b3ee0e0a
Link: https://github.com/openSUSE/docker-containers-build/issues/29

commit_message:
Add a shim extension standard-attr-segment

Standard attributes has been added to segment [1] and we need
a shim extension to indicate this.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558318/

Change-Id: I761fa7cb684a457726dedc95fde92d6adb86f5e4
Partial-Bug: #1765008

are associated with the use of native mysql{@} units for
bootstrap and startup of mysqld.

Change-Id: I50c5642e11393da3bc03de0ef0b9af4c32e9a0c9
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for PXC 5.7 and xtrabackup 2.4

Bionic will ship with Percona XtraDB Cluster 5.7 and a newer
version of Percona XtraBackup; the majority of charm changes
are associated with the use of native mysql{@} units for
bootstrap and startup of mysqld.

Co-Authored-By: James Page <james.page@ubuntu.com>
Change-Id: I50c5642e11393da3bc03de0ef0b9af4c32e9a0c9

commit_message:
Configure plugins and policies after RabbitMQ

At the moment, plugins and policies are configured before RabbitMQ
is configured, which means that certain things like enabling the
management plugin might fail because some of the configuration
parameters that you've added are not baked in yet.

This also makes more sense that you would configure the instance
once you have a properly configured RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: Ie78d72fd8c5255a1effcca4f9e83a324d121b088

commit_message:
Add nova/ironic/glance cross-service vars to group_vars/all

Given that nova implements a compute service for ironic
it needs access to some of the vars. This moves the vars
out of isolation back into the all space. The same goes
for a glance var which ironic needs.

While this is not ideal, it is the established pattern
and this patch needs to be ported back to Queens.

Change-Id: I2f65a0b26e8d46729959d87ae0dafcdba61c619f
(cherry picked from commit 3b325b7dbcc39764b14cd74f682b56caf91713a4)

commit_message:
Fix osa_toolkit dictutils import

Currently the inventory-manage tooling does
not work correctly because it cannot find the
dictutils/filesystem libraries in its path.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 02:19:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix tripleo_ui_config.js for OS APIs

UI needs to talk to OS APIs via internal network, not public network
(since we're using http, it's more secure). It makes the UI working with
a containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: Icb6f75706e70be60cd0641307087e1340d351334
"}, {'created': '2018-04-16 16:57:20.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-ui: configure proxy_pass with public endpoints

TripleO UI is binded on the public network, because it seems we expect
our users to reach the UI from public network (and not internal).

It means that we also expect them to talk to the OpenStack API from the
public network and not internal. So we need to change the proxy_pass
rules in Apache, so the redirection happens on the public endpoints.

Change-Id: Icb6f75706e70be60cd0641307087e1340d351334
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-ui: configure proxy_pass with public endpoints

TripleO UI is binded on the public network, because it seems we expect
our users to reach the UI from public network (and not internal).

It means that we also expect them to talk to the OpenStack API from the
public network and not internal. So we need to change the proxy_pass
rules in Apache, so the redirection happens on the public endpoints.

Change-Id: Icb6f75706e70be60cd0641307087e1340d351334

commit_message:
Fix repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle effectiveness

The repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle is supposed to trigger
a rebuild of the venvs, but currently it does nothing.

This patch fixes that, making it possible to rebuild the
venvs without having to rebuild the wheels too.

Change-Id: I61db1f5555cba2c659ff09d8369ce3c31b011b5d
(cherry picked from commit 81051b0d469380b9b7bd0c56ece81da97738f7a8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 18:32:56.000000000', 'message': "Only attempt a rebuild claim for an evacuation to a new host

Change I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b changed the
behavior of the API and conductor when rebuilding an instance
with a new image such that the image is run through the scheduler
filters again to see if it will work on the existing host that
the instance is running on.

As a result, conductor started passing 'scheduled_node' to the
compute which was using it for logic to tell if a claim should be
attempted. We don't need to do a claim for a rebuild since we're
on the same host.

This removes the scheduled_node logic from the claim code, as we
should only ever attempt a claim if we're evacuating, which we
can determine based on the 'recreate' parameter.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): test_rebuild_with_new_image does not exist in
Ocata and does not apply to Ocata since it is primarily
testing allocations getting created in Placement via the
FilterScheduler, which was new in Pike. As a result the change
to that test is not part of this backport, but a similar assertion
is added to an existing rebuild unit test.

Change-Id: I7fde8ce9dea16679e76b0cb2db1427aeeec0c222
Closes-Bug: #1750618

commit_message:
Only attempt a rebuild claim for an evacuation to a new host

Change I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b changed the
behavior of the API and conductor when rebuilding an instance
with a new image such that the image is run through the scheduler
filters again to see if it will work on the existing host that
the instance is running on.

As a result, conductor started passing 'scheduled_node' to the
compute which was using it for logic to tell if a claim should be
attempted. We don't need to do a claim for a rebuild since we're
on the same host.

This removes the scheduled_node logic from the claim code, as we
should only ever attempt a claim if we're evacuating, which we
can determine based on the 'recreate' parameter.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): test_rebuild_with_new_image does not exist in
Ocata and does not apply to Ocata since it is primarily
testing allocations getting created in Placement via the
FilterScheduler, which was new in Pike. As a result the change
to that test is not part of this backport, but a similar assertion
is added to an existing rebuild unit test.

Change-Id: I7fde8ce9dea16679e76b0cb2db1427aeeec0c222
Closes-Bug: #1750618
(cherry picked from commit a39029076c7997236a7f999682fb1e998c474204)
(cherry picked from commit 3c5e519a8875a9766a0d3a06cb76cceba26634e6)
(cherry picked from commit 9890f3f69622489a0fd57cb1df354d7aa60161e0)

commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary lazy-loads in mutated_migration_context

If the instance isn't being migrated and has the
migration_context attribute set to None, like during a rebuild
operation, we should detect that and exit early rather
than lazy-load several fields (numa_topology, pci_requests,
and pci_devices - all separately) and then just not use/need
them.

Change-Id: I071ab575bfd80db029d542cebfdb3d4e34227881
Closes-Bug: #1696221
(cherry picked from commit c3d466dd4d9739844404fdd9c4170c4a8284a4aa)

[{'created': '2018-04-14 15:40:21.000000000', 'message': "Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

commit_message:
Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Closes-Bug: #1764046
Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553
(cherry picked from commit 065779517f9c99a80fbc39d51784c614e4ee341c)

commit_message:
Use full list of remote etcd units

To ensure that vault can always access an etcd unit, configure
with a comma delimited list of remote units, rather than just
the first one as currently returned from the reactive interface.

Change-Id: I967228a7fd2bbfdba0628660d473202815d52f80

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 18:30:18.000000000', 'message': 'Re-order database migrations

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the
sequence of tasks. This also now happens to be necessary due
to changes in the Rocky API database.

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771
Related-Bug: #1761775
(cherry picked from commit 68f51e94867081a5c1f8169589f0c88984111cd7)
'}]
commit_message:
Re-order database migrations

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the
sequence of tasks. This also now happens to be necessary due
to changes in the Rocky API database.

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771
Related-Bug: #1761775
(cherry picked from commit 68f51e94867081a5c1f8169589f0c88984111cd7)

Change-Id: I1d295f01e389f6704619a6cd562e1c8f0a631632

commit_message:
Fix obtaining env spec in case of old deployment format

There is special warning which notifies about deprecated format of
deployment component. It also prints an adopted version of deployment
config to simplify migration. Unfortunately, we used wrong attribute for
environment specification.

Change-Id: I1d295f01e389f6704619a6cd562e1c8f0a631632

messages: [{'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nHashes check out.'}, {'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 13:15:35.000000000', 'message': 'Tag networking-powervm 6.0.1

Requests a tag for networking-powervm 6.0.1.

This is the first tag request for networking-powervm in
openstack/releases so the yaml file did not previously exist. This
adds some of the previous branches and tags to that file as well
for the sake of tooling.

This is done in the _independent directory because
networking-powervm was not yet under governance in the Queens
timeframe.

Change-Id: Ic553bf3e9c138d026ccd4e2980dda064a729333c
'}]
commit_message:
Tag networking-powervm 6.0.1

Requests a tag for networking-powervm 6.0.1.

This is the first tag request for networking-powervm in
openstack/releases so the yaml file did not previously exist. This
adds some of the previous branches and tags to that file as well
for the sake of tooling.

This is done in the _independent directory because
networking-powervm was not yet under governance in the Queens
timeframe.

Change-Id: Ic553bf3e9c138d026ccd4e2980dda064a729333c

commit_message:
Add snap channel support

Add a new configuration option 'channel' to support deployment
of vault from channels other than stable.

This superceeds the layer option which is dropped as part of this
review.

Channel config option changes are honoured, but vault may not be
restarted depending on whether the local vault service has been
unsealed.

Change-Id: I845cd8db3a7e80155f2b485bb3f07934476996f2

commit_message:
Rename devstack-tempest to tempest

The job naming convention says the job name should start with the
name of the repo where the job is defined.
I think we should follow that convention for a base job.

Change-Id: Iafdd01770a00cb1b74078a816e4dbf7e6e7b6099

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 14:26:24.000000000', 'message': "Add basic network spaces support

New extra-binding - 'access' - is used to configure in frontend
Vault API address.

The 'cluster' relation is used to configure inter-unit cluster

commit_message:
Add basic network spaces support

New extra-binding - 'access' - is used to configure in frontend
Vault API address.

The 'cluster' relation is used to configure inter-unit cluster
communcation in HA deployments.

Change-Id: I72031fef5c59e9aeb90f0dee1aea65c2ad27aef7

commit_message:
Refactor status assessment

Perform a number of new checks to assess the status of the
local unit:

 - Presence and completeness of relations
 - Status of vault (initialized, sealed)
 - Configuration of memory locking

This review also switches a number of 'status_set' calls to
be 'log' calls to avoid continually polluting the Juju status
display with non-pertinent information during update-status
executions.

Change-Id: I4e467a76bb0951deda8a88c609f4c79f4b0b33f4

commit_message:
Unpause Xenial builds

dib 2.14.1 should address the issues we had with getting a network on
boot (Iae88a3b0457bab0b8f0fd1febf58732ca95e5dc9).  Note that building
this will release pip10 more widely, as it will be included in the
base image.

Change-Id: I5b64e4dbd5693ce63520c72e6033c7242eba8deb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 07:57:16.000000000', 'message': "unbreak unit tests for neutron-lib master(1.14.0)

This patch includes two fixes to unreak unit tests with
neutron-lib master.
neutron-lib master introduces version update of eventlet 0.22 and
pecan 1.3, which breaks several unit tests.

pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment:
From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

eventlet 0.22: HttpProtocol.__init__ changed:
From eventlet 0.22, HttpProtocol.__init__ signature was changed
to take 4 argument to 3 argument.
Adjust constructor call.

Change-Id: Iac955a7de2a1b66b5b56a73f5cc8a4e75150f82e
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 14:08:30.000000000', 'message': "pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment

version update of pecan 1.3, which breaks several unit tests.

From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

commit_message:
pecan.jsonify v1.3 adjustment

From pecan v1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan v1.2 uses simplejson.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

Closes-bug: #1754978
Change-Id: Iac955a7de2a1b66b5b56a73f5cc8a4e75150f82e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 13:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pause ubuntu-xenial DIBs"

commit_message:
Fix repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle effectiveness

The repo_build_venv_rebuild toggle is supposed to trigger
a rebuild of the venvs, but currently it does nothing.

This patch fixes that, making it possible to rebuild the
venvs without having to rebuild the wheels too.

Change-Id: I61db1f5555cba2c659ff09d8369ce3c31b011b5d
(cherry picked from commit 81051b0d469380b9b7bd0c56ece81da97738f7a8)

commit_message:
update translations for queens

Update translations for the Queens release.

Note: this is being cherry-picked from stable/queens to master
instead of the other way around. The translations were actually done
based on queens, so that is where they were originally merged. In
hindsight, they should also be merged in master so that it has the
latest translations as well, so we should have followed the normal
process of merging in master first, but too late for that now.

Change-Id: I374eae9b0ef4bdd049d9b26b6bb27258c7907143
(cherry picked from commit a29ca2b75ed3a4cdd6e725f1f6a1d8e026e1771d)

commit_message:
Extend linters time out

Linters are extended to 15 minutes. A few jobs have been just
reaching the 10 minute deadline, so using 15 minutes should
leave plenty of wiggle room.

Change-Id: I1473d55498d72f5611ae09e0d2e7b709954bb363
(cherry picked from commit d515c1074a1c46c84406d499f488f2b1a0247266)

so we need to have a CI job which we can run against

commit_message:
Add neutron-tempest-postgres-full to experimental queue

From time to time we have bugs that affect postgresql
so we need to have a CI job which we can run against
nova patches to verify those fixes. This adds the
neutron-tempest-postgres-full job, which is defined
in the neutron repo, to the experimental queue so it
can't block nova changes but can be run on-demand.

Change-Id: I445240bddbd421c1e22f2f539aff925812d56744

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 20:51:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes binding type for OpenDaylight Websocket

For OpenDaylight Websocket connections we were not using transparent
binding type with HA Proxy.  This means that HA Proxy was not able to
start on nodes that did not have the VIP because it was unable to bind
to that IP on more than one node.  However, transparent binding works OK
with OpenDaylight Websocket and should be fine to enable so that HA
Proxy is able to start on every controller.

Closes-Bug: 1764514

Change-Id: I89e6115795ece6735e816ab71b5b552b17f7b943
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-04-17 14:51:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes binding type for OpenDaylight Websocket

For OpenDaylight Websocket connections we were not using transparent
binding type with HA Proxy.  This means that HA Proxy was not able to
start on nodes that did not have the VIP because it was unable to bind
to that IP on more than one node.  However, transparent binding works OK
with OpenDaylight Websocket and should be fine to enable so that HA
Proxy is able to start on every controller.

Closes-Bug: 1764514

Change-Id: I89e6115795ece6735e816ab71b5b552b17f7b943
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes binding type for OpenDaylight Websocket

For OpenDaylight Websocket connections we were not using transparent
binding type with HA Proxy.  This means that HA Proxy was not able to
start on nodes that did not have the VIP because it was unable to bind
to that IP on more than one node.  However, transparent binding works OK
with OpenDaylight Websocket and should be fine to enable so that HA
Proxy is able to start on every controller.

Closes-Bug: 1764514

Change-Id: I89e6115795ece6735e816ab71b5b552b17f7b943
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ica3ed89483129cdbeb9869302b6f38e7b3cb5b6e

commit_message:
Add HTTPS support to K8s API healthchecks

Our Controller and CNI healthchecks are checking the connection to the
K8s API. This is done using the requests library directly and not
through K8sClient wrapper. Because of that we've forgot to add HTTPS
support there (DevStack runs K8s with HTTP).

This commit fix that by making /healthz requests to go through
K8sClient wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d2657dfb123a7641eb838d7ddecde769bbb4318
Closes-Bug: 1759293

[{'created': '2018-03-27 16:20:14.000000000', 'message': "Add `privileged` SCC to SA in OpenShift DevStack

In containerized OpenShift deployments we're not attaching `privileged`
SCC to `kuryr-controller` SA created by DevStack plugin. This causes
kuryr-controller Deployment and kuryr-cni DaemonSet to fail as
`kuryr-controller` SA lacks permissions to run privileged containers.

This commit solves that by using `oadm` to attach the SCC to SA.

Change-Id: I2c827cd986a17e08c94558c852b4a225cfe057a6
Closes-Bug: 1759287

commit_message:
Add `privileged` SCC to SA in OpenShift DevStack

In containerized OpenShift deployments we're not attaching `privileged`
SCC to `kuryr-controller` SA created by DevStack plugin. This causes
kuryr-controller Deployment and kuryr-cni DaemonSet to fail as
`kuryr-controller` SA lacks permissions to run privileged containers.

This commit solves that by using `oadm` to attach the SCC to SA.

Change-Id: I2c827cd986a17e08c94558c852b4a225cfe057a6
Closes-Bug: 1759287

commit_message:
update translations for queens

Update translations for the Queens release.

Note: this is being cherry-picked from stable/queens to master
instead of the other way around. The translations were actually done
based on queens, so that is where they were originally merged. In
hindsight, they should also be merged in master so that it has the
latest translations as well, so we should have followed the normal
process of merging in master first, but too late for that now.

Change-Id: I0622d237a53114929d56cfb46bbb7d60887099d6
(cherry picked from commit e62fae699d47feacd7372573948722cd0036996c)

commit_message:
Remove spurious VxLAN bridge IP from ceph osd hosts

The Ceph example includes 3 osd nodes which have been assigned IP
addresses on the VxLAN network, which are not required.

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Fixing the entry for eventlet now also requires fixing the rest of the
lower constraints settings. One setting that was incorrect was
setuptools, and it is removed because projects should not need to
depend on specific versions of the installation tool.

Change-Id: I09189b6d2e6a9f2387f7c9716a5d862595d8ef3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:46:03.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks

At present the Libvirt driver can preallocate file based disks using the
fallocate command and importantly the `-n` option. This option allocates
blocks on the filesystem past the initial EOF of a given file:

```
$ touch test.img ; fallocate -n -l $(( 1024 * 1024 )) test.img
$ ll -lah test.img
-rw-rw-r--. 1 stack stack 0 Apr 16 13:28 test.img
$ du -h test.img
1.0M	test.img
```

This results in a miscalculation of the total disk overcommit for file
based (excluding ploop) disks as os.path.getsize is currently used to
determine the allocated size of these disks:

```
>>> import os
>>> os.path.getsize('test.img')
0
```

Using the above example the disk overcommit would be reported as 1.0M as
the disk appears empty yet will report a potential (virtual) size of 1.0M.

However as the required blocks have already been allocated on the
filesystem the host will report disk_available_least as missing an
additional 1.0M, essentially doubling the allocation for each disk.

To correct this the allocated size of file based (excluding ploop) disks
is reported using `disk_size` from the `qemu-img info` command. This
should ensure blocks allocated past the EOF of the file are taken into
account and correctly reported as allocated.

A future change should ultimately remove the use of the `-n` option with
fallocate, however as this would not help disks that have already been
allocated this has not been included in this change to simplify backports.

Change-Id: If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594
Closes-bug: #1764489
(cherry picked from commit 23bd8f62634707fc9896a38ff4dae606c89c6c4b)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks

At present the Libvirt driver can preallocate file based disks using the
fallocate command and importantly the `-n` option. This option allocates
blocks on the filesystem past the initial EOF of a given file:

```
$ touch test.img ; fallocate -n -l $(( 1024 * 1024 )) test.img
$ ll -lah test.img
-rw-rw-r--. 1 stack stack 0 Apr 16 13:28 test.img
$ du -h test.img
1.0M	test.img
```

This results in a miscalculation of the total disk overcommit for file
based (excluding ploop) disks as os.path.getsize is currently used to
determine the allocated size of these disks:

```
>>> import os
>>> os.path.getsize('test.img')
0
```

Using the above example the disk overcommit would be reported as 1.0M as
the disk appears empty yet will report a potential (virtual) size of 1.0M.

However as the required blocks have already been allocated on the
filesystem the host will report disk_available_least as missing an
additional 1.0M, essentially doubling the allocation for each disk.

To correct this the allocated size of file based (excluding ploop) disks
is reported using `disk_size` from the `qemu-img info` command. This
should ensure blocks allocated past the EOF of the file are taken into
account and correctly reported as allocated.

A future change should ultimately remove the use of the `-n` option with
fallocate, however as this would not help disks that have already been
allocated this has not been included in this change to simplify backports.

Change-Id: If642e51a4e186833349a8e30b04224a3687f5594
Closes-bug: #1764489
(cherry picked from commit 23bd8f62634707fc9896a38ff4dae606c89c6c4b)

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26507, 'name': 'Michel Peterson', 'email': 'michel@redhat.com', 'username': 'mpeterson'}]

[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for this! The change looks fine, but I think we need some documentation for it - in the role docs perhaps? How this works and how to override LIBS_FROM_GIT.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-02 15:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

uhm unit tests are failing...'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-02 18:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

uhm it seems that LIBS_FROM_GIT only works with actually libraries, this needs some more attention.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-07 11:00:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

One possible way forward here is to specify some exceptions in check_libs_from_git, to ignore tempest, devstack and requirements. However that may be not enough. Tempest plugins will be installed in tempest virtual environment, so they won't show up in a global pip.

I think probably the cleanest approach is to separate LIBS_FROM_GIT and required projects. We can still have a dedicated variable under job.vars that is consumed by the project if you wish, or we could simply add this into devstack_localrc."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-16 18:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-16 18:49:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, we could manually deal with LIBS_FROM_GIT, but I feel like the user has already expressed what they want to have happen with required-projects, so I think we ought to be able to convince a computer to do that.

I've updated the patch to do the extra work to not add things we know will fail the check."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-16 23:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-17 00:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-17 00:24:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've uploaded PS5 which takes a different approach -- it makes the libs_from_git check safe for this method, at the expense of opening a slight opportunity for human error if a human writes a LIBS_FROM_GIT line.  I think the convenience is worth the risk (especially since the risk is reduced by using the new job and automated generation of the config)."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-22 18:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-03-22 21:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

This looks good, thanks. We should probably check that this is working fine in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548331/3.

Since this is a significant change in behavior compared to d-g, I think it would be good to publicize it a bit in the ML before it merges.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-23 20:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck stackviz'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-03-26 13:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-04-02 08:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Also there is an inherent problem as to how the requirements are installed. When installing a package through this library it calls `_setup_package_with_constraints_edit` to make sure that this package is installed from source. However, it does not take into consideration that the {test-}requirements.txt might have packages that also might be present in LIBS_FROM_GIT. The end result is that those packages present in LIBS_FROM_GIT and in the requirements file will be installed them from the PyPi index instead.

I understand that this comment might exceed the scope of this patch, still it should be probably addressed because it has implications on this patch.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-02 11:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-04-05 15:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-04-05 16:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Michel, I believe the situation you describe shouldn't be a problem.  There are two cases:

* A libs-from-git project is installed via some project's requirements.txt file before the "if use_lib_from_git setup_develop" invocation.  In that case, the later "if use_lib_from_git setup_develop" call will reinstall the project from git.

* A libs-from-git project appears in some project's requirements.txt file after the "if use_lib_from_git setup_develop" invocation.  In that case, the previous setup_develop call would have updated the constraints file to write the git version, therefore the existing installation will match the constraint and nothing will change.

It's true that if anything goes wrong with that system, this change removes the final sanity check that would catch that, however, that's part of the trade-off I'm proposing we make.  And since both of those cases seem covered, we aren't relying on the final check to catch an expected error.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-11 07:46:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-04-17 20:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-04-17 20:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

This PS is the previous PS with the child change ( https://review.openstack.org/549252 ) squashed into it.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-04-18 07:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Thanks. wfm.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

> Michel, I believe the situation you describe shouldn't be a
 > problem.  There are two cases:
 > 
 > * A libs-from-git project is installed via some project's
 > requirements.txt file before the "if use_lib_from_git
 > setup_develop" invocation.  In that case, the later "if
 > use_lib_from_git setup_develop" call will reinstall the project
 > from git.
 > 
 > * A libs-from-git project appears in some project's
 > requirements.txt file after the "if use_lib_from_git setup_develop"
 > invocation.  In that case, the previous setup_develop call would
 > have updated the constraints file to write the git version,
 > therefore the existing installation will match the constraint and
 > nothing will change.
 > 
 > It's true that if anything goes wrong with that system, this change
 > removes the final sanity check that would catch that, however,
 > that's part of the trade-off I'm proposing we make.  And since both
 > of those cases seem covered, we aren't relying on the final check
 > to catch an expected error.

I don't have now a chance to explain further here, but I don't want my concern to go unvoiced. I'll expand on this on Monday.

In the meanwhile, I think this conversation in the ML [1] points to a potential problem.

I think with the addition of the checked out paths in PIP_FIND_LINKS [2] the problem would be solved. What do you think?  

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129464.html
[2]: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c/inc/python#L362'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Michel, I don't think your reference [1] is related to this patch.  I'm merely trying to add some syntactic sugar to something that has been functioning for years in the same way.  I'm not changing how anything is actually installed."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I agree with Jim, this does not change the current behaviour, it only adds a way to trigger the same behaviour as before, but automatically, from job properties.
When devstack is executed outside of a zuul CI job it will behave the same as today, except for that check that happens in a different place, but that does not alter the install process.

Could you please follow up either here or better in IRC or via the ML to express your concerns with the installation process?'}]

commit_message:
Automatically set LIBS_FROM_GIT based on required projects

If a project shows up in zuul's required-projects list, add it
to LIBS_FROM_GIT automatically.  This way, when a user specifies
that a job requires a zuul-project, it gets used in testing, but
otherwise, it doesn't (pypi is used instead).

Also add information about what happens behind the scenes for both
LIBS_FROM_GIT and plugin dependencies.

This moves the check performed in check_libs_from_git to
a helper function which is installed for most kinds of
installations.  This means that if someone sets LIBS_FROM_GIT to
"foobar", devstack won't error anymore, as nothing is going to
try to install foobar, therefore the check won't run on that.
However, as we move to automated generation of the local config,
that error is not likely to happen.  This check was originally
added due to an error in the upper-constraints file (where a
constraint name did not match a package name).  This location of
the check would still catch that type of error.

Change-Id: Ifcf3ad008cf42d3d4762cfb3b6c31c93cfeb40db

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771

commit_message:
Re-order database migrations

The database migration sequence currently implemented were
required for Newton->Ocata as cells v2 was being implemented.

Now that cells are in place already, we can simplify the
sequence of tasks. This also now happens to be necessary due
to changes in the Rocky API database.

Change-Id: I101e75f70a7c99ceb1129c9c224f6a303dfae771
Related-Bug: #1761775

against get_node_list instead of get_nodeinfo_list, this patch
corrects them, and amends missing calls after rename.

commit_message:
Extend linters time out

Linters are extended to 15 minutes. A few jobs have been just
reaching the 10 minute deadline, so using 15 minutes should
leave plenty of wiggle room.

Change-Id: I1473d55498d72f5611ae09e0d2e7b709954bb363
(cherry picked from commit d515c1074a1c46c84406d499f488f2b1a0247266)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 22:01:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docs for confirmResize action

There are three things fixed here:

1. The server status would be VERIFY_RESIZE, not VERIFY_RESIZED.

2. The RESIZED value is on the OS-EXT-STS:vm_state field, not
   vm_status.

3. The migration record status must be "finished", which is what
   gets set on the migration record in the _finish_resize() method
   in ComputeManager and used in the comptue API.confirm_resize()
   method. "confirming" status is what the API sets the migration
   record to before casting to nova-compute to finish the
   confirmation.

Closes-Bug: #1764878

Change-Id: Ib751686880ee824cf0693a649f47c828f515b471

commit_message:
Fix docs for confirmResize action

The docs had three things wrong:

1. The server status would be VERIFY_RESIZE, not VERIFY_RESIZED.

2. The RESIZED value is on the OS-EXT-STS:vm_state field, not
   vm_status.

3. The migration record status must be "finished", which is what
   gets set on the migration record in the _finish_resize() method
   in ComputeManager and used in the comptue API.confirm_resize()
   method. "confirming" status is what the API sets the migration
   record to before casting to nova-compute to finish the
   confirmation.

Stepping back, this is too many conditionals for what is really
needed. So rather than fix all three items individually, this
change simply fixes the first one and removes the other two since
the 'status' is based on the 'vm_state' internally, and a non-admin
user cannot list migrations anyway, and the _finish_resize()
method sets the migration status *before* the vm_state.

Closes-Bug: #1764878

Change-Id: Ib751686880ee824cf0693a649f47c828f515b471

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 20:39:29.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
